title: View Ponit
review: Good View,Spend time with friends and enjoy the natural beauty.

title: Fun point
review: It's a package of many things...you can enjoy ropeway as it is the way of reaching at the peak or you have to climb by your own..views are beautiful, eateries can provide you snacks,fun games, shops offering traditional Garhwali dresses for pictures and even fun rides for small kids.

title: Peak of Mussourie
review: This place is the highest point in the city. Offers breathtaking views of the entire hill station. Also have maggi at the top

title: Nothing much to see
review: You need to take a cable car from the town to reach Gun Hill. Return tickets are Rs 125 per person. The cable ride is short and nothing much to do up there except for shopping.

title: Rope way is the best part
review: Rope way which is the only way to reach gun hill is the only best part of Gun Hill attraction. It gives a beautiful bird eye view over Mussourie hills. Had a great time here

title: Gun hill tracking
review: Gun hill is one of the most beautiful attraction of Mussoorie. Actually this was place where drinking water is stored for summer demand and daily supplied for people . Although there is trolly to reach on the top of hills but other root is for trekking too.its approximately 2 km straight climbing with beautiful view of area. Tracking starts from Roselyn hotel along Mall Road to gun hill via mount rose place name.

title: Good
review: Mussoorie has God given beauty.... All hills have amazing views. Especially, the valley views. Nice.

title: Avoidable
review: The place for queue  for the trolley is disgusting, dirty and uneven.When you reach to the top at gunhill, disappointment and sadness prevails as you see all the views blocked by unchecked and haphazard  tin lined shops.The games,rides and quality of food served is substandard as in village fair/melas.I am not posting any pictures as I did not find worth clicking.

title: Waste of Time
review: Fully Commercialized, You will not get a proper view from the mountain due to commercialization. I would suggest you to visit Lal Tibba which is way better than Gun HIll.

title: Decent one time visit
review: Visited this place very recently and found it OK

title: Nothing much to offer
review: You need to take cable car from Mall Road to reach gun hill . There are only two cars there , so even in off season we had to wait around 40 min either ways .  When you reach there whole area is surrounded by shops and food stall . There are just two or three points which are open for a view .  You can get similar view from many places in Mussoorie so not worth.

title: Allow drivers to take you
review: Steep uphill offering a good view however unsafe if you are driving yourself .

title: weekend trip
review: nice place to view the mountains. spend some time and enjoy the cool breeze, reasonably clean sorroundings

title: Trip to Gun Hill
review: Firstly trolley experience is very good. my 6 yrs. old son was very happy to sit in trolley and astonished at gun hill as an open place to play.

title: View point
review: You can have a awesome view of Himalayan peaks covered with snow. It's worth seeing if you are watching it for first-time . It's in mall road ,walkable or can be reached through rope way.

title: Enjoy the winner
review: It's my first time it's a beautiful place and mainly it's trolley but my time trolley was not working but fully enjoyed

title: Just Ok
review: We had to climb up n down walking as on that day the cable car was not working and had some problem.  Though it was a good exercise but not worthy...when you reach in top, the view is somehow hidden with all the shops surrounding the area and only about two spots are available to have a view of the mountainous and tht too not clear.  Ok i can imagine a fun ride on a cable car with a view and thts the main attraction  otherwise nothing on top. Its just over hyped...don't waste your time unless you have nothing to do.

title: Nice spot spoilt by Shops
review: Pros:

title: Highest Point in Mussoorie with nothing on most days
review: We took a rope way trip to Gun Hill point, it is a 5 minute journey costing Rs 125/- per person. On a clear day it is said to give you visibility of upto 200kms as per locals but on our day of visit it was a sunny but hazy day so it served no purpose. In monsoon it is said to be quite misty so that again defeats the purpose or fun of long range visibility. At the top, there are various basic eateries and basic gaming shops which are everywhere in Mussoorie as you'll find out. It is not worth anyone's serious time unless you've nothing else to do. I suggest to skip it.

title: Beautiful scenery ruined by dirt and clutter.
review: 1.The view from the top is absolutely stunning, no doubt. But, the place where this amazing view can be seen is just in front of the washrooms.

title: Top of the hill
review: One  of the highest point of mussoorie. You can see a nice top view of Dehradun city and all around  mussoorie from here

title: Very Touristy on Top
review: We walked up from just along from the roundabout at the start of Mall road. The walk is nice, although a bit steep in places and there are no signposts (the only place where it is not obvious is when you get to the Mahindra Hotel, you go down to the right), but plenty of people to ask. The last part to the top is particularly steep.

title: Old carnival with a view
review: The view is pretty so it is close to the city and you can get a nice view, and if you don’t want to walk to Gun hill there is a lift which is free. But once you get to the top, it looks like s rundown carnival. There are few shops and games you can play, even a haunted house. But is looks like crap and even the “restaurants” up there are pretty had looking

title: Second heighest point of mussoorie
review: Soo it's second heighest point of massoori ..with food shops up there , fully commercialized. You can reach up there with ropeway. The view from top is very good. If you go in morning you can see Himalayas from there but ropeway service starts around 10:00 AM.

title: amazing
review: Once u get on the top in the cable car you will certainly enjoy the place...

title: WASTE OF TIME
review: It was an experience worth forgetting. First of all, from  the point  where rope way starts and the cabins of  the rope way  give a very bad impression with no maintenance at all and secondly when you reach at the top point  called the gun hill  you are stranded in between some very basic fete like stalls which have covered all the area and left no place to view the area for which you have actually come.

title: Must visit place
review: This was awesome... Take a rope way from mall road to reach here... Have awesome pictures, views... Go for some food and drink also

title: Its a waste
review: We went to the gun hill point and was amazed to see that from all four sides it was covered with stalls.  We had to look for a corner from where we could see the view of the mountains.

title: Nothing Great
review: Nothing great. Waste of time and money. Rather go for a walk or cycling on the camels rock road or the mall.

title: Terrible
review: Rusty Old cable car takes you up the hill ( ₹125 per person on Dec'18) for a view.  The view blocked by restaurants and shops. currently it has a temple and water reservoir. There is nothing for a tourist to do here, waste of time.

title: Good
review: Nice place for abreak

title: It is just a roof overcrowded with restaurant and shops blocking all the view
review: We went to Gun hill trekking all the way. Journey was beautiful with spectacular views. However actual Gun Hill point was disaster. Imagine a big roof and in all four sides there are shops and restaurants blocking all the view. You stand in middle and all you can see is haphazard rows of shops and thats all.

title: Cable car Ride and Mounting view
review: Pay Rs 125/- per person above 1 years of age. it will take to one mountain top where you will find many kids games shop and Couple of restaurants. You can have a Good mountain view from there.

title: View point with cable car ride
review: Took a cable car ride to & fro had 125/-per head on top there are view points and gaming zones

title: Generally okay
review: Cable car ride to and from the top was fun. Nothing great really on the top. There are many shops on top selling trinklets, games and food. They block most of the view unless you go to the edges.

title: nothing great
review: It is nothing great and just an average point with some game counters and food restaurants. Absolutely waste if running on a strict time and budget,

title: Average
review: A pretty average place with a distant view of Himalayan snow peaks only on a clear day.

title: ON TOP
review: Ride by Cable car, provide you extra excitement. Once at top, view is good of in and around Mussoorie. Food is costly then below.

title: Time pass
review: Time pass only.

title: Dr Paramjit
review: Rocky and cemented track from Mall Road to the top of the hill.enjoyed the natural beauty though it was raining it seems to be a helipad

title: Cable car ride
review: It is just the fun of cable car ride. In peak season, queue is very long. Nothing much to do at the top. Kids can play some games, you can enjoy a cup of tea with local cuisine.

title: Underrated place - beautiful views!
review: This place seems to be a little underrated and is one of the lesser known places in Mussoorie.

title: highest point of mussoorie
review: Gun hill is a point which will come in your mind when you visit mussoorie. This is the highest point of mussoorie. There is a trolley ride which takes 125 rupees for up down service.. It takes around 4-5 minutes to reach the top . Overall the ride is bumpy and scary but it is totally fun and thrilling ride . Everyone should try this ride but the view up there would really add cheery to the cake .. The views are just so beautiful and relaxing. we can spend quite number if hours up there just roaming around and enjoying maggi and tea.. there are good food stalls and games for kids.

title: Stuck in. Time
review: There is a cable car going up to gun hill. It about a 3-4 min ride and a waiting of 15 mins plus to get on the cable car... once ur up at gun hill it’s got a couple of shops selling Maggi etc, some shooting games .. other than that nothing much to do... it’s an attraction which needs serious upgrades..kids strollers are not allowed on the cable car. So one has to leave it at the bottom and then take the car

title: One time visit to watch the awesome view of himalayas and mussuorie city. 100/- charges for return ticket timber trail
review: You can also track to the view from pedestrian track from mall road to gun Hill,  if you are full of energy,  better to visit on the view in a sunny day,  otherwise you will not be able to enjoy the full view.

title: It's more of a cheaper version of a shopping place and a food court than a viewing point.
review: Okay so Gun hill has a great view of the town and the mountains. It's indeed beautiful. What isn't beautiful however are the shops that occupy most of the hill. They block most of the splendid view and you somehow have to try and get behind these shops to get great views of the valley. The shopkeepers keep on harassing you meanwhile to play games in their stall and eat bad food which they serve. My suggestion is that you cam skip this and go the other places which offer simillar view of the valley, for eg, Clouds End or George Everest's house or Dalai Hill.

title: Feast for your eyes
review: For first timers, it’s a place not be missed. One can take a cable car or track(guts n stamina required) to reach the place. It’s a small n cosy place with beautiful valley views, perfect for a picture shot. There is a telescope point where one can explore the far end points with ease. Sit, relax at the small restaurant located beside the valley with a cup of tea/ coffee, Maggi

title: Waste of money
review: Nothing there to see. 125/- for a 5 minute cable car ride. When u reach the top, you will find nothing but some shop to play kids games, 2-3 small old cafeterias serving Maggie, momos, paranthas etc. The view isn’t too great either. You can pay to look at some mountain views through telescopes. If you see mist or too many clouds then don’t go since you won’t see any view at all.

title: Romantic & Couple Friendly Location
review: Gun hill is one of the highest peak to enjoy romantic view in Mussoorie.

title: Time pass attraction
review: This is place for natural beauty to see city from top with beautiful views rest not very much to do their.

title: Nice view of Dehradun and nearby places of Mussoorie.
review: Nice view of Dehradun and nearby places of Mussoorie. It is one of the highest place of mussoorie hill. At the top, you can enjoy some food in small restaurants there with wonderful view all around. Good to go in Sunny Winter day.

title: Viewing sunset along with cup of coffee from Gunhill is worth it
review: We did a little downhill walk and climbed back from behind the hill. The road is very peaceful with very few homes on the way. There are shops at the view point on Gun hill. You can sip your coffee and enjoy the sunset from here. If you are here during winter, witnessing the famous winter line is a must.

title: Visit to Gun hill  Mussoorie  by cable car
review: Visit  to  Gun hill  Mussoorie by  cable car  is a  good  experience  for once. Cable  car with 12 people  on board  is a  bit  crowded. Fare is also on higher  side.  There is no hospitality if you  are  looking  for  some. The flat space at the top is good. The vendors are far too many for a small place and very shabby. Very mediocre. You pay Rs 5 to use the  urinals. Very good  opportunity  wasted by the  authorities.

title: OK OK..SO SO..
review: Though it is a historic point but nothing can be done here...few stalls offering highly priced and average food....

title: Great view with quaint eateries and fun for kids
review: Good view from the top however the cable car needs to be modernized. Quaint eateries offering food alfresco with children's games at the top.

title: nice view from the top
review: you reach gun hill via a cable car which operates from the mall road and generally has queue where you have to wait...once you reach it is a nice view from up there...lots of shops selling nick knacks ...lots of maggi and omellete and chinese food places up there to satisfy your hunger pangs...not sure about the hygiene though....

title: My recent visit here
review: We visited Gun Hill while our stay. The view was really good. The place is average. Food items are bit costly here. Other shops are also present here. Overall it was a good experience.

title: must visit
review: This point is the second highest point of Mussoorie i.e. 6640 ft. One can reach this place by taking the rope way which provides a spectacular view of the Doon valley. You can sip on hot tea and have Maggie while taking in the breathtaking 360 degree view of the Himalayan ranges namely Bunderpunch, Srikantha, Pithwara, Gangotri group etc. The ropeway costs INR 75 both ways .

title: Not worth the time
review: Not worth visit unless:

title: Holiday
review: Nothing much to write about it. Nothing special about it. Have to wait for long time for trolly to go up to the point. Same food that u get on mall road is there at gun point view also. Not worth visiting here.

title: Excellent place
review: Tourise visit Gun Hill to enjoy the clear sky and long distance views. So huge rush when no clouds in the area.

title: Long Wait but cable car ride worth it
review: For getting to Gun hill, you have to pre-purchase a ticket and during the annual tourist rush season, average wait time to go up is around 3 to 3 and half hours (which we were not prepared for)

title: Shop if you want too!
review: Lots of lovely shops if you want to buy something and you can take the cable car from here. Lots of good places to eat as well

title: Local authorities have spoiled the place
review: This used to be nice place to enjoy panoramic views along with strong breeze, but it seems local authorities have given in to greed and allowed shops everywhere which has resulted in blocking of all views. Would recommend only to first time visitors, if you have seen this is old days, don't bother wasting your time and money.

title: Ropeway ride and nothing else
review: If you wish to enjoy ropeway ride, go for it. But expect absolutely nothing from the Gun Point itself. Apparently it used to provide some panaromic view buy not anymore. You will get some quick snacks and desi games for kids. And a small temple to visit.

title: don't use the trolley service when coming down
review: fun and enjoyable trek kind experience while the descent. though the ascent by the same route can be exhausting for many.

title: Just enjoy ropeway
review: Nothing special to see here. View and weather is good. Kids enjoy coming and going by ropeway. Lot many game shops for kids

title: Terrible place , not developed a all.
review: this is sheer waste of money and time. The trolley lift is good for kids , but Gun Hill is seriously over rated and to be avoided.

title: Awesome experience
review: Gun Hill is one of the popular tourist attractions of Mussoorie, possessing historical significance dating back to pre-independence. It is believed that a canon was fired from the place at a fixed time on every afternoon. This firing at the hill provided an idea of time to the local residents of the destination and they adjusted their watches accordingly.

title: Waste of time and 125/- per person
review: There is nothing to watch and enjoy but you get to waste time money and energy and all you get is a ride in cable trolley

title: absolutely worthless
review: nothing on the gun hill just a few shops selling magic instruments or jewelry and small eateries, the view is worth it but nothing much to appreciate

title: Good view
review: Gun Hill is located at 6800 feet above sea level, and it is the second highest point of Mussoorrie after Lal Tibba (8000 feet). We took cable car ride to reach there. From the top  we enjoyed a good view of Himalayan ranges, and  Mussoorie town. The place is over crowded with restaurants, shops, and  attractions like balloon shooting, taking picture in local dress, purchasing souvenirs.. One temple is also there on the top.

title: Good view from the Top but too much shop
review: The Gun Hill is situated on mall Road few kilometers above. It can be visited by Ropeway and also by walking. We chose walking...The walking experience was nice.. while going its all right..but while climbing down.. a few places were steep.. there one has to be careful.. The view from the Top was really good.. We could see almost the whole of Mussoorie.. But what I didn't like.. at the top, there were too many shops so that spoilt the view a little. Overall good experience.

title: Gun hill point
review: It's waste of time and money taking rope way to reach gun hill point. You can also reach there by walking. Rope way will cost you Rs. 125 per person. Gun hill point has beautiful views of valleys.there are many restaurants. I would suggest you to not to eat there as the food is costly.

title: Superb Location
review: Nice hill top place. Enjoy this for chill breeze and views. There is ropeway, too. Use stairs for better experience, instead.

title: Ok place
review: Only thing of adventure is rope way ride .otherwise nothing.not good eatery available.only people asking for games

title: Totally Commercialized.
review: Yeah, It has some beauty, If you love shoping, ofcourse have a visit, but there is nothing so big up on the hill, except the cable car. The view from the car is good

title: Gun Hill
review: Gun is one of the highest place in Mussoorie. You have to go by cable car. If you love tracking than there is a route for trackers also to go on foot. Which is also enjoying but only good for young tourists. On top there is a flat concrete place with lot of eating joints and photo shops with Pahari dresses for you to get pics in different dresses. Its very cool place through out the year and very cold during winters .If you are lucky you can get snow also on top during winters. You can see snow clad Shivalik range.

title: Okay place
review: Before starting trip of Mussorie Gun hill was in my top itenary.

title: Best View of City
review: This is a place for Viewing Sunset, to reach this place one need to take ropeway from Mall road. Once you reach the top there are food joints and game to enjoy, There is one temple, make sure to visit there as from there one can have an overall view of the Mussoorie and best place to view the sunset. The wind keeps on blowing with a pleasant breeze.

title: Good view point but better ride
review: The view point itself is good and you get a guided telescope view of 10 points

title: Gun hill
review: A place more for gamming and shopping .....

title: Must see in Mussorie
review: The experience of Rope Way from Mall Road to the top of the Gun hill and back is a nice one - only downside is the waiting for the Rope Way.

title: Typical hillstation kind of environment
review: Its a typical hill station environment with game stalls flourishing with the odl fashioned and some new games

title: No proper management
review: We went to gunhill office and bought tickets around 6pm and our turn was around 7:40pm ,but it started raining around 7:00pm. We tried to refund the ticket but she denied. Many people with small children's asked a refund but they denied stating they cannot do anything.Also stated what if raining we are sending people.Up there all shops are in open and once rained no use of going up there.People coming back stated no use of going.

title: Gun hill.
review: Gun hill is a point at mussorie. You can travel their by roopway. You can get excellent views for pictures from there. You can play games there and also staisfy your hunger as there are many small stalls to eat.

title: Visit once Nothing there
review: As the name suggests nothing is there and the views are blocked by petty restaurants

title: Avoid gun hill
review: The muncipal authorities of mussourie have indeed destroyed the jewel of mussourie. This used to be a place to be, many years ago where you could get magnificient views of the mountain ranges and the doon valley.  Now you have to make do with crappy dhabbhas, roadside magic, and cheap souvneirs confirming that mussourie is no longer a destination for discerning travellers looking for a standard quality holiday. If you make your way to the restroom or a corner here and there, you may get some messmerising sights of the valley behind mussorie.

title: Just the Cable Car!! Too much mela on the top.
review: At an altitude of 2024m, Gun Hill is the second highest point at Mussoorie.

title: Avoid
review: Not worth paying 125rs / person , waiting in a 1 hour queue and visiting the gun hill point . There is nothing much to do at the point except for some rundown hotel , shops and gambling games .

title: Scenic point
review: Gun hill is the most scenic point of Musoori u can view the Himalayan range with snow cliff mountain from there. At it was rainy so not able to enjoy the place

title: Top of mussorie
review: A cool place for a nice winter sun and a view of Himalayas. Can be accessed by a ropeway. The service is good. A lot of restaurants and photo stalls where you can get local costumes are available. Can enjoy with a hot cup of tea.

title: Cable Car Ride to Gun Hill
review: We wanted to go to Gun Hill point and took a Cable Car Ride to Gun Hill, it’s a very high elevation point but the only exciting thing is the Cable Car Ride which is very nice and exciting and goes up quite high,

title: Waste of time
review: it was a waste of time. there was nothing that you will like. you just enjoy the ride to gun hill through cable car

title: Must visit for novelty value
review: The cable car is accessible from the mall road and is walking distance from library chowk or one can take a cycle Riksha . Riksha costs about 50/70 RS for a family of 3 . We had to pay for the cable car ride. It took about 6/7 minutes to go up. The view on top is amazing. There are small stalls where you can play games and shops selling the usual stuff. There are small places to eat as well. It's a must visit for the view and it's not very expensive.

title: Rope way ride
review: Rope way ride was exciting and a bit unnerving contemplating the drop.  At the top,  challenging game available.

title: a must visit
review: Best spot of mussoorie to enjoy the 360 degree view of mussoorie town and himalayan ranges. Ropeway is equipped there, one can grab it in 125 inr for return journey. Usually waiting time at ropeway is 15-20 mins. Some gift shops and food joints are there. Best to visit in evening time.

title: Very crowded and commercial
review: Spent an evening here. It's a very crowded and busy and noisy marketplace. Will not recommend  to anyone looking for peace and solitude.

title: Nothing great about this place
review: One has to take a ropeway to go upto the Gun Hill point and Ropeway is the only attraction. Otherwise, there is nothing attractive at this place. all the area is covered by shops and restaurant leaving very small area to view the Mussoorie valley.

title: Well Maintained, Clean and Beautiful views
review: This is must watch, while you are in Mussoorie

title: Very bad
review: It's a very bad location don't ever try to go only few shops are there they have blocked all the view from the top the government should understand the point fun people are not there only for shoping need to sit and one of the food stall to see the view

title: Clean & Beautiful View
review: This place is really amazing. You can go by walk or take a ropeway to reach Gun Hill. This place is good for sunrise and sunset. The see the whole Himalaya, wonderful view and great location. You can find lots of food joints there.

title: Try few childhood games but quite costly
review: Can enjoy multiple childhood games and magic trick shops which are present on top. But prices are quite costly with the winning stuff you get.

title: Nothing to see like gun and the name of hill  gun hill point
review: I have visit there before two days ago  with my wife .... there is nothing to see like gun hill point ...only the shops there and shopkeeper charges so high ..... never visit again

title: Amazing views
review: A really low but awesome hill, known for its repeating voice calling when you shout from here, inspiring

title: Nice quiet view point
review: In the afternoon trip crowds were minimal.

title: Good
review: A good ride by cable car . The games on the hill were for kids and adults too.  Food too was available. Also most important. It had a decent washroom

title: Barely room for any views
review: We went upto GunHill via the ropeway, which cost us 125/person. To be honest, the ride up was a better experience with decent views compared to Gun Hill point itself.

title: Sameeksha By Sachin - Amazing Views & Enjoyable Cable Car Ride
review: Gun hill is one of the popular tourist destination in Mussoorie. It is the second highest peak after Lal Tibba. Gun Hill is situated at an altitude of 6640 feet approximately. One can reach to the Gun Hill easily by boarding cable car from the cable car station (popularly known as Jhula Ghar) which is situated at Mall Road approximately 500 meters from Library Chowk. It is said that a gun was installed there during the colonial rule which was fired at mid day to facilitate citizens to adjust their watches. It was really enjoyable to reach to the Gun Hill by Trolley. View from the trolley was beautiful. There are many restaurants, Game shops etc. at Gun Points but these shops are really hindering the 360 degree views. However whatever views from the Gun hill can be seen are really amazing. Paid Binoculars are also installed at Gun Hill, one can see the far situated points such as Lal Tibba, Nag Devta Temple etc. from there with the help of Binoculars. Panoramic view of Garhwal & Shivalik Ranges of Himalaya were mesmerizing. It was really chilly there in the evening, one must carry the woolens while visiting Gun Hill. This is one of the recommended places by me in Mussoorie.

title: Gun Hill is too commercialised
review: Gun Hill is located above the Mall Road. You can walk up there or take the ropeway.  However, it is not worth the visit.  At the top there are shops and more shops.  The views are spoiled by all the shops.  We did not walk up there but i hear yo can get some good views on the way up rather than the top.  This attraction is avoidable.

title: Must go in Mussoorie
review: Visited via ropeway. It is located in central Mussoorie. The place gives excellent view of doon valley and Mussoorie city. A mst go in Mussoorie

title: disappointing yet fun
review: It was nice to go up the cable car and play games at the Gun Hill.But the cable car was disappointing. Dirty and worn down. You can actually have all the entertainment on the Mall road itself.

title: Must visit by tracking
review: Second highest peak in Mussoorie, at an altitude of 2,024 m (6,640 ft), can be located by a trek in 30 minutes off the Mall Road (Near the mall road police station) or directly by Ropeway/Cable car in 2-3 minutes. When I was there some repairing work was going on for ropeway so that time cable care facility was not available so we decided to track (very easy and scenic) the gun hill by foot and it was taken about 30 minutes to reach at gun hill with my 4 year kid. It was really an amazing and adventurous during tracking (very easy) and I think it is better than rope way/cable car. At the top point the sight seen was good but there was a lot of commercialization and numbers of shop around the hill so the natural beauty of hill is hidden by shops. Recommended to see this place only by tracking (very easy & scenic).

title: It was just Ok. Not great
review: Gunhill point is a little hyped. It is like a fun fair on a hill top. It does give a view of mussoorie from the top but some of the well located hotels too give a good view or even a better view. Gandhi chowk also give a good view. But since it is one of the few attractions at mussoorie it is worth going there. But dont keep great expectations otherwise you may be disappointed.

title: Visit with friends
review: Travelled by Cable car to Gun Hill.One May walk down .Nice walk .Tea and Pakoras are delicious .May photograph in costume.Breathtaking views of Himalayas .

title: Useless place
review: As bad as it can get. The ride via the ropeway is 5 minutes with waiting time of 30 minutes either way. Nothing to do at the top. You dont see any snow clad Himalayas as well. The eating options are sub-standard. Highly recommend NOT going there

title: The best money making plan devised.
review: Guess someone with the right links managed to get approvals to ferry tourists from base to a hill point which also doubles up as a location for the towns water tank.

title: gun hill
review: nice experience on cable car the charges are nominal but the duration is only 10 mins to the top and back. There is a mall on the top you can buy stuff have food take pictures. Good

title: A real disappointment
review: I visited Gunhill after many years and was disgusted to see how the place had been spoilt! It used to be a major attraction at one time. We used to go there to see the spectacular 360° view of Mussoorie. Now the whole place has only shops selling over priced things and game stalls. There's hardly any open space left to see the view. Do not visit. A complete waste of time!

title: A hill to climb... and spend money!
review: Apart from the cable car rope way, which takes you up the hill, there is nothing much to do here. There shops on the hill where you can shoot arrows, shoot air gun, get yourself clicked wearing traditional gharwal dresses, see some 8-10 points from a telescope (like Sachin Tendulkar's house!) and climb down sitting in the ageing cable car rope way.

title: Hike was fine, but peak was extremely crowded with shops
review: Dont bother with the trolley. Just hike up to gun hill. On the way you'll get to see brilliant view of the city and mountains. Best part is 75% up the hill. Take all your picture in here.

title: BEAUTIFULL MUSSORIE HILLS AT GUNHILL
review: Terrible experience , trekking, cable car and view HIMALAYAN panorama from the top hill;beautiful tea , beautiful sunset ; no other spot can give you such experience.

title: Just for view and some timepass
review: So so place, not worth much of time , may be you can visit just because you want to try ropeway and get some good view of valley.

title: Fun Time with friends
review: I came to Mussoorie so many time and I love to explore different place with my friends.

title: Very average
review: The views are modest and the food options are also average. Maybe you will enjoy the ropeway ride bit nothing else otherwise.

title: Worst place
review: I don't know what's there to see in Gun hill. This place is a waste of time & money if you are going via ropeway. We went there via ropeway & to out disappointment there wasn't anything. Don't go please

title: Cool place
review: It's a very good place to hang out with your friends and for couples also very well organised it was a natural environment

title: Average place. Can be avoided.
review: This used to be a good place but now became too much commercialized. Natural view is now hidden by the shops. Can be avoided if possible.

title: Once a beauty; now encroached by shops
review: This is a perfect example of how the administration has miserably failed to preserve this place. Once a paradise and fabulous viewpoint of the valloy, it has now been totally encroached by shops and there is no view point left. There is litter all around and the shopkeepers have made a mess of this place - What a shame!

title: 360 degree view of Mussorrie
review: It all starts with a ropecar drive to the top and a telescope view from the highest point. You  get lot of fun activities to relax over there . The photograph with the rented pahadi costume is a must for couples who go there.They do it very lovely and its a memory to cherish.

title: The ropeway ride in moosori
review: Location :10 mins walk in mall road

title: THE BEST OF BEST
review: 100rs ticket for a ride up & down so cheap rate charges but view is Breathtaking. I enjoyed the view of every place seen from there especially St George School shooting place of Jo Jita Wohi Sikandar, Lal Tibba, Nag Tibba,  Sachin Tendulkar Mansion,  Busy view of Mall Road & Mussoorie during Night it's Amazing

title: Gun Hill view Point
review: This view point can be reached byt 1/2 km uphill walk from the Mall road . This place is crowded with small shops and eateries and not well maintained. To have a clear view of Shivalik range of Himalayas ,one need to  go the back side of the shops . A good place  to view sunrise and to watch Himalayas in the evening time .

title: for timepass
review: this place is just having the games to play.

title: Amazing sunset view
review: A nice steep walk for trek lovers. Else u have the option to queue n wait for the cable ride. Sunset view worth from the top!

title: View whole Mussorie from the highest point
review: Mussorie is a beautiful city & so is this place. We were group of friends, hence preferred walking early morning all the way upto top. Surprisingly the cliff is not too tough to climb. The area is quite large & one may have adequate view of the wholr valley. There are facility of telescopes too, so that one may watch the far-off snow capped Himalayan mountains too. Overall, this place deserves once-a-visit.

title: Waste of money n time
review: Ur only going up the trolley to a terrace to play some silly games n do over expensive shopping.. it is completely avoidable!!!!

title: Very ok
review: The point up is really ok n not so great as expected jus a good sunset seen from the place can go if u have nothing else to do

title: Avoid
review: This place can be avoided as there is nothing to see here. Visit there if you want Gandola (ropeway) ride because ropeway will take you there from the mall road.

title: Top most point in Mussoorie
review: This place is visited for the splendid view it offers.  The place can be reached through a cable car. The views of the Himalayan ranges and peaks from the Gun Hill point is spectacular.Tranquility rules the air here. You can enjoy being in solitude for hours together.

title: Gun hill without gun
review: Ropeway takes two minutes from station. Area was full of stalls selling different items. During clear sky snow peak of kailash can be visible. Not much activity there except ropeway ride.

title: Just for a view in clear sky only
review: nothing specific here, it is just a point from where you can see Himalaya that is too inn clear sky only. Choose only if you have nothing else to do.

title: Something is better than nothing....!!
review: This peak in Mussoorie is famous to view Himalayan ranges but you might feel sad if you go just with that aim.

title: Good
review: The top most point of Mussoorie hills. The english administration got the water supply tanks made here for supply to the town. Take the cable car to reach the top. Enjoy the breathtaking view of the himalayas and the Dehradun valley.

title: Can skip
review: DID NOT LIKE THIS PLACE AT ALL. Too crowded. Shops scattered like bugs. Dirty and waste of time and money.

title: Lost earlier charm but a visit
review: Earlier it was a must visit but now not as beautiful as before.

title: amazing  view of Himalayas
review: Views of snow white Himalayas are great, unending arrays of Hills , tiny houses, fresh air, warm sun , sunsetting and sun Rise from here is great experience, one can use ropeway and also can take a walk , don't go to too top( dogs are there near the water tank).

title: OK, no great view as they claim
review: Rs.  100 per head entry to a trolly that takes u to top of fun hill. They have eating points and game stations for gun shooting (balloon gun shooting)  and other games.

title: Fantastic hill!!!
review: The gun hill is very amazing and fantastic place to visit. my son loves this place very much. The hill view was excellent

title: a must visit place
review: we liked gun hill. visit in morning will be great. good weather. rope way experience was great. long queue for cable car. but everyone should visit here. at least once

title: Gr8 view point
review: The view from thr is just awsm the himilian range view from this point is just woww just that the view of mall road in the night blew my mind

title: "BEST FOR PANAROMIC VIEW "
review: Gun hill is located approximately 800 feet hight. Facilities of Roapway is there for comfortable journey. You can see the entire doon valley from the hill. Beautiful lighting view after the sunset.

title: Small Trek with Good View point
review: This is a very basic and small trek ( 500 Meters ) starts from Mall Road. Overcrowded & view from top is ok. Better to go Lal Tibba.

title: Good for first timer
review: This place is good for the first visit, having a wonderful view and top of the city, but you will find a wastage of money if go second time.

title: Waste of time
review: There is a small flat lane (a few acres) at the top of "Gun Hill". The whole place has been taken over by hawkers. One can climb or go using a rickety rope-way. Do not waste time going to thus place.

title: Fantastic views but overall nothing much @ Gun Hill
review: Great views once you reach the top but it's not really worth the time & effort to go up the rope way.

title: must visit
review: Travel by cable car with super view of mussorie worth travelling to point number of shops to shop , eat . nice spending some time on top

title: A fair view
review: There are two options, either walk up to the point or take a ropeway. The top however wasn't that interesting to me. It was more the walk up.

title: Kids had fun
review: A mundane place. Small activity shops. (Shooting balloons, ring game, telescope, merry-go-round). Reaching there by a ropeway was nice. Reading about the history of gunhill was fascinating. Steaming hot Maggi noodles was yummy.

title: less than average
review: To most places we have come across that they aren't beautiful what you may have heard and this place is one of them.

title: Must Visit once..
review: Gun Hill is the second highest point of Mussoorie . It is accessible by a cable car, and it offers an enthralling view that one shouldn’t miss! The ropeway ride is fun and all above gun hill thrill.

title: Mussoorie water tank
review: The well celebrated water tank for Mussoorie water supplies has been converted to a picnic destination, top of the town fresh air, eating points makes you feel at to of the world, a must go preferably during day light, nights shall give only vision of lights. Try it if you are in Mussoorie.

title: Full of Fun
review: It is on the hight. We enjoy playing the Games. There are good Hotels for Lunch and Dinner with Good taste and Very Low priced

title: A pay for ride and view location
review: If you have not ridden in a Cable car or a ski lift before this might have some measure of novelty for you.  The shops you find below are to be found at the top of Gun Hill, so nothing exciting about that ‘view’.  To make the trip up worthwhile take the rope path.. great exercise.  As to the view at the top..look towards the East near Sisters Bazzar / Landour area.. you are looking UP and no charge for view, in fact one restaurant there has a free set of binoculars to view Himalayas’.   Much to do about little.

title: Nice Pictursque view
review: Not maintained, why turn everything into commercial the beauty of gun hill top is ruined by numerous shops, garbage here n there. Best time to visit is early morning

title: Excellent spot for bird's eye view of Mussoorie but ruined due to encroachment & commercialization
review: 2nd highest peak in Mussoorie, can be located by a trek in 30 minutes off the Mall Road or directly by Cable-car ( Gondola ) in 2-3 minutes. Offers excellent bird's eye view of Mussoorie town & Doon valley  & the Himalayan range on a clear day, but the top of the mountain is ruined by encroachment by vendors & too much commercialization. Just average spot - allot approx 30 minutes for thsi spot.

title: Interesting View
review: It was interesting as you can opt to take a cable car up to this location. There are some very localised fun fairs on top there. Other than then spectacular views, there is nothing much going on up there

title: Tacky
review: Queued for the cable car. At the top was the tackiest, filthiest fun fair/market attraction - yuck! Only one tiny gap to see the view, which was shrouded in mist. The best bit was walking back down.

title: Hill top by ropeway
review: Gun hill is the highest point of musourie.

title: It's not worth a visit
review: This is one of the overrated places. If you are planning to go to gun Hill then you will have to go to a Mall Road. If you have got a private vehicle between 4 to 10 p.m. is not allowed. If I got a commercial vehicle means yellow plate then you will not be allowed to enter into Mall Road. So you will have to take the rickshaw up till rope shifting. They are the charges are Rupees 100 per person for up and down. Once you will reach to the Gun Hill you will find nothing but surrounding shops for playing games and few hotels.

title: Best views destination in mussoorie
review: I have visited here with my friend to take a view of full mussoorie aandbit was the great location very nuce views from the gunhill point thanks .....         ...............

title: Excellent if!!! you are lucky....
review: Let me put it this way... If you are lucky and you have perfect (almost) weather... and if you can see far away... this is a definite YES -- place to visit.... if weather is bad.. do not bother as this place is all about ... views!!!

title: Only cable car is worth
review: This place is worth visiting only if you go by cable car. Because once you reach the gun hill  that place is a mess. You can see only the small shops all around with zero view. This place is around 1.5 km from mall road entry. Rickshaw will charge 50 rs. Cable car costs 100/ per head including return journey. If u really want to go there go on a clear day.

title: Trip to Gunhill
review: One has to have lot of patience to reach the hill as you will find a huge queue to purchase ticket for the cable car to reach the gun hill. The crowd behavior are pathetic where you will find one person buy ticket and in the end you witness 20 to 25 ppl join the queue. The queue management was not great here, so you need to wait a lot to have your chance to board the cable car. Post that the view in the hill are excellent and you ll find decent tea shop over there to have some refreshment. Our mood got spoiled because of the earlier incident and we didn't spend much time in hill and we are more worry about standing in queue again for return trip from hill back to land. Overall it is good sans the initial crowd clearance on the cable car.

title: Can be skipped
review: You can avoid this place. If you want to go, there are two ways to reach there. Through cable car, which charges 100 INR per person and by walking, which is 500 meters upward walk. You cannot find anything special on the top.

title: Wonderful Hill
review: Situated at a height of 400 ft above The Mall,the location presently houses a water reservoir of the destination.Tourists can witness snow capped peaks of Himalayas and The Mall on either side of the place.

title: Reliving childhood
review: It was not much changed since my childhood visit...... food is not very gud here... very spicy.... but u get gud tea and coffee......an eating place on backside near the restrooms is better than the one in centre place...... view from there is beautiful....u can shoot all day long there

title: nothing to see. average
review: as such there is nothing to see. may go by ropeway but there nothing to look around. just some shops.

title: Not worth your time
review: It is very ill maintained cable car. I have visited Nainital cable car and up hill amusement park. Nothing closer to it. No system of scheduled time, so you need to take tickets and stand in queue on first come first serve basis. Waste of time. The start station is poorly maintained. Walls do not have plaster. Condition of cable cars is also not good. Up there every thing is so dull and boring. Cemented ground surrounded by shops of gun shooting, few basic games for kids, some restaurants, some souvenirs. Quality of shops, activities is very poor. Some views are there but not worth the time and hype.

title: lovely
review: its a peak above mussorie , u go there by cable car , its lovely view from up there and lovely weather here all yr along

title: give it a miss
review: definitel not worth the visit. Please don't waste your time it's just a hype and is certain to disappoint you.

title: Awesome view
review: Gun hill is just above the mall road in mussorrie.The view of the mountains and the city was awesome.Their are many hotel at the gun hill and the view from them was very beautiful.

title: beautiful
review: the view of city from gun hill amazing. you can take maggie from restaurant at normal price. enjoy ropeway. shanidev temple is good. many shops there. and weather was cool in summers.

title: Is there any reason left to visit this place in present circumstances?
review: It must have been a 'must visit' place in earlier times but now it is a great disappointment. Tourists are promised 360 degree view from Gun hill but as you reach up you get a 360 view of stalls selling tea,pakora, kulcha or offering you to shoot balloons. There are only two-three corners left unoccupied by shops from where you can get a narrow view of mountains and valley. Every website tels you that it is second highest point after Lal Tibba and is located 400 meters higher than base at Jhulaghar but hardly any site tells the following-

title: Was good
review: It rained that day . The weather was nice . Good view from there . It was quite as it was an off season . There are 2 ways to go here either by ropeway or walking

title: In between the clouds
review: Very nice place to be but the charge of cable car through which you can reach here is expensive. Also it is crowded with shops

title: Nice, in limits
review: Mussorie is a day trip for most of the tourists. After or before walking on the Mall, you can ascend the Gun Hill by a small ropeway. The views are good, do look at St. George School. The top is full of touristy curio shops, shop at your own will. I recommend sipping on chai and Maggi towards Landour side, in evenings, chilly winds contrasting with the hot tea.

title: Lucky and you get the Himalayan view
review: This is a point that gives a new dimension to your trip to Mussoorie. Take the rope car for a wonderful glimpse of hills surrounding Mussoorie. If visibility is good, you can even see the Himalayan range. Beware of monkeys. Don't miss the ginger tea and shopping atop the gun hill.

title: Gun hill
review: So called sightseeing option in mussoorie, the Gunhill has nothing different to offer other than the regular mountain views. Go and visit only if u have extra hours and nothing else to do

title: just for scenery
review: Either walk for around 500m -1 km or take the ropeway. i preferred walking. on reaching the top i was bit disappointed as it is covered with lots of shops and scenic beauty is disturbed. however you can enjoy fun shooting and other activities at nominal prices.

title: Overhyped place
review: There are two ways to reach this place..

title: Visit to Gun Hill
review: The ropeway trolley is good, but the entire path way is choked with plastic bags and look so dirty. Hope the UK Government will arrange to completely ban plastics, clean the area and also make a nice point well maintained for boarding the ropeway trolley. One can visit Gun Hill at least once.

title: Enjoy the weather
review: Slightly more than 500 m above mussoorie - meant only to enjoy the weather and relaxation.

title: Used to fire Gun during colonial rule
review: You can take the ropeway but I will suggest to use the walkway to reach at the top. It will take 20-25 minutes to reach there from Mall Road. But it was really exciting and little adventurous too. midway you will get spots to take good selfies also. At the top, there are too many shops pertaining to games, eateries, sovereign etc. we had hot maggi and other snacks with tea. Kids had enjoyed playing games.

title: Breath taking View
review: We visited Gun Hill in November 2016.

title: Amazing is the only word.
review: It's just beautiful. You get to see the Mussoorie city clearly from the top as well as Dehradun valley. Beautiful place. Must try the rope ways.

title: Gun hill..
review: i will recommend you this place only if you want to experience ropeway ride.. Apart from this couples avoid this place .. Overcrowded with huge families and kids.. Uff

title: 6000 feet above the ground
review: A high altitude place accessible by foot or through a trolley. Offers views as well as varoious eateries and certain prize-winning games you find at a carnival.

title: Waste of Money
review: I went to Gun Hill twice. one by taking the foot way and the other time taking the rope way. After visiting it twice I figured it's waste of time, money, energy.First time I liked the journey in rope way but my excitement went away as soon as I reached the top. there was nothing. only some vendors selling overpriced goods, some shooting guns shops for kids, which I believe is the origin of the name of this place.The second time I took the other way and reached the top by walking through the roads which have been formulated for the tourists who want to go on foot and my experience was the same on top. The second time I liked my journey to the top because of the scenic beauty. I don't think one should go through all that trouble to climb up and find nothing.even if you are taking the rope way, I believe its waste of money, you can get better rope way journey than this in many other places of India.

title: Gaming zone
review: From Mall road Mussorie take Cable car to the Gun Hill point. It is 100 rs per person. Inside the cable car is not well maintained. At the top of the Gun Hill you can play different games. This is good place for children, because they enjoy a lot enjoying those games. I have tried lot of games but unfortunately I m not so expert in those games. Have some Tea,coffee and snacks there and enjoy the surrounding cold environment. Returned to Mall road with cable car with the same ticket.

title: Go only if it is a sunny day
review: I went to Gunhill point on 25 June 2017. It was a cloudy day. All clouds and no view. Above there there are some games stalls including shooting, Archery, rings etc. Just like ones which we use to play during school and college fests. There are also some eating places. Majority of them offers maggi and eggs. Couple of might also offer other fois as well frankly I didn't eat there as I already had my lunch.

title: Yuck place to visit
review: One can go here just to stroll on mall road and eat. Tickets are cheap like Rs.100/person and waiting time is around an hour and half. Cable car is extremely disgusting in condition and maintenance. Gun hill has nothing. Totally waste of time. Littered area with almost falling shops which pester u to eat their stuff and get pics clicked. Please skip it.

title: Must go place
review: Place is good to see.so many shops for shopping the goods at good prices

title: Place for Kids Enjoy
review: To reach the Gun hill one has to take the Ropeway from below at the Mall road. Ticket 100/- for round trip. The height of Gun hill is 500 meter. So you will enjoy the ride. After reaching there you can play games and eat at restaurant. And can have a view of the below.

title: Gun hill view point
review: This  view point is on the Hill, from  this point you can see the scenery around. to go to this point you have to take ropeway from the Mall road and the ride on ropeway was good.

title: Over hyped Avoid it
review: We had gone to Gun Hill. At the top it has been highly commercialized with shops along all the boundary of top flat. Therefore there is no way a traveller can get the view of the valley and city. There is no place to sit and relax at the top.  It was total disappointment and waste of time and money.

title: Strenuous walk up the hill
review: There are 2 ways to go to Gun Hill. One is taking the ropeway and the other is walking. The ropeway had a long waiting period hence we decided to walk up. The signboard from the aquarium say 500m but it takes atleast 30-40 minutes at a normal pace to reach up as it is quite steep.

title: Not that great a place
review: You can either take the rope way or a steep pathway which goes up. Few small restaurants located on top. Nothing great about them. View is descent though.

title: Can avoid it
review: I just took the rope way for my 6year old otherwise the view is nothing compared to other places in mussoorie

title: All scenic
review: Nothing but scenic views , not too large a place but definitely a long walk up there.

title: Valley view point
review: You can go to this place by cable car.you can enjoy the nice valley view and mall road view from cable car called rope way. Once you reach gun hill it's a small area with some restaurants and game shops

title: average
review: Just for the sake of visiting you can visit but it is not a great spot at all.  just to add a spot in your list.

title: Rope way, scenic view
review: Rope way ; views for photo-shoot, nothing other than this.

title: Centre for fun and recreational activities
review: The hotel seclude, where we stayed was near to the spot where Gun hill was located.We walked 3km through the Mall road,had some shopping,snacks and reached the place where we have to take ticket for cable trolley to reach gunhill point. It was an amazing  experience going through ropeway and reach gunhillpoint. Lot of recreational activities(games,magictricks,shooting etc)  were arranged and there was an arrangement  for view from telescope also.We can have view of Lal tibba, ..etc as this is highest Point  of mussorie. We had a lot of fun.

title: Not much great place
review: One may visit this place just because it is a tourist attraction place but frankly there is nothing much other than entertainment for small kids. It is just a table top on which some stalls of games are put up.

title: Avoid going to to Gun hill if it rains..
review: we were stuck for 2 hours as heavy rain stopped the movement of the cable car and it is scary to be stuck on hill top in an evening while it is raining and you will have to wait for the rain to stop as then only the cable car operation is resumed and you could come back.

title: Options for Games, Picture in dresses and Nothing else
review: You have options for some good games like Hula hoops and lucky draw etc. Get yourself clicked in dresses, but thats it. Nothing more to do. Food is mediocre and best avaoided.

title: Gun hill
review: This place is very beautiful because from this place we can see Mussoorie city view.

title: Nice place to spend some time at this spot in Mussoorie
review: 2 ways to reach this place, cable car would be a better option. As soon as you leave cable car and explore this spot, lot of shops are there for gifts, eating, for engaging kids in gun shooting, rings game etc, food joints are average here but one can enjoy a cup of tea with maggi/ pakoras etc and have a view of valley

title: Planning a Mussorie stay
review: If staying over, find a good hotel within walking distance of the Mall Road. Fortune Resorts is a good place to stay.

title: Scenic beauty
review: Basically it is a scenic place situated in high altitude; main attraction is ropeway; not much activities are available on the top; however; you may find some shops for articles; children games such as shooting archery magical games rings etc. Telescopic view point offers you to see some of the well known points in and around Mussoorie through chargeable telescope.

title: Go for the joy ride
review: The final destination at the top is a big let down. Poorly maintained, most of the restaurants are in bad condition. There are a few joy rides for kids but all are badly maintained. However the journey up and down is worth the money you spend as you get some nice views. Also the view from thetop is mesmerizing.

title: Top notch!
review: Great views after a slow, safe ride to the top in a cable car.. Small eating joints and telescope viewing add a quaint charm to the place..

title: Average
review: You have to take ride by a ropeway to visit this place. Not much to do at the top as there are most shops of games like balloons and shooting, etc. The food quality was not so good.

title: No reason of this being called as tourist spot.
review: we were excited to visit this. after a queue when we went uphol by a gondola. what we found was that people are drinking at the restaurants. The food is bad. even they couldnt prepare a normal Maggie. they even charge for the disposable glasses. You can find ancient games like shooting balloons with air guns and throwing ball at the cups.

title: Spoiled view
review: The whole viewing area is occupied by shanties offering snacks and carnival game kiosks who fool customers into spending. You have to sit in one of the snack shanties to get a view of the hills or valley.

title: Old Name no guns to see
review: You can take a cable car from The Mall Road around the middle opposite the State Bank ATM. Get some view on the way up. On top there is not much to do. There are some curio shops and some places for gaming. The main attraction is from the view point spent some money to see the best school, the best hotel etc! But towards the east you have some view of the snow mountains Gangotri and Yamunotri. Can see the the Lal-Tiba and some villages across the mountain

title: Very Poor.
review: Please don't visit until you are with kids. The whole place is filled with shops same as the Mall road. No isolated place, no peace of mind. Kids can enjoy the ride otherwise a just waste of time and money. They charged ticket for more than 1 year old which is very unfair.

title: Accords beautiful view of sunset at dusk
review: The Gun Hill is known to accord views of Snow clad Himalayas, the Doon Valley and Sunset at dusk. We visited in the evening so couldn't catch the former two cause of mist, however watching sunset whilst sipping tea at the corner cafe was a surreal experience. Would recommend to buy one way ropeway ticket (waiting time is loonnng) and then, to hike back to the mall road (well maintained pathway).

title: Not worth....
review: It is simply not worth buying a ticket of Rs 100 per persona and then wait for the Rope-way Trolley for 30 minutes and then reach this point. There is absolutely nothing here except many shops selling snacks and having games.All the views have been covered by these shops. Only at a corner you have 4 men showing some buildings/landmarks using Binoculars.A complete waste of money and time and an ideal example of how to spoil a beautiful place.

title: Gun Hill.
review: This is just a high Hill from where you can have a good view of Mussouri town.You have to take the rope way to reach. There are a couple of shops for games and refreshments. There is huge storage tank which might have been used by the British to store water.You can not stay there for more than 30 minutes.

title: Nice place on top of Mussorie
review: It had very beautiful view from the top. It was all green from there. You can see all mussorie and other places from there.

title: Nice view
review: I enjoyed evening here if you are with kids they got lots of Gambling games to  play,you wont win but still you will play

title: Gun hill - all commercialized
review: This point offers some good visibility of Mussoorrie but point is totally commercialized by hawkers. Nothing new is offered at this point ...

title: Nothing good
review: It's a small place with some games and food outlets which u have to reach by a trolley from Mall Road. Not worthy.

title: Nice but ok
review: Gun Hill. Sounds weird na but don't worry this hill don't gonna kill you, This hill have a rope way if you're an rope way lover so you should go to this place to visit and take a rope way ride at least once

title: Not as good as I thought
review: The place is highest point on mall road and is accessible by rope way. There are many small shops selling toys, some games and tea and snacks stall. There's a telescope point where for 50 rupees you can view different spots in Mussoorie. If weather is good then the himalayan range can be seen. Otherwise its just a visit to a spot. Nothing great. Can give it a miss.

title: Value for the time spent
review: Went with my family consisting of children and they have somehow enjoyed. The cable car tour is excellent. The sight of valley during evening from the cable car is only enjoyable. The unique dress supplied at the top is really very good. The quality of food at hill top is really rubbish and it is advisory not to take anything there. The waiting time is much. The most worst thing is to load more than capacity people in the cable car by the authority but nobody is caring after the complain also.

title: Nothing more than a joy ride fir kids
review: The ride to GunHill , which can be accessed from the Mall, is nothing more than a joy ride for kids.

title: Just Another Point!
review: Quite similar to the points in every other hill station. Games, food and snaps. Can be accessed by rope way only. Go for it, if you have exhausted all other options in Mussoorie.

title: Point to Visit !!!
review: Gun Hill is accessed by ropeway from the ricksaw stand on the mall road.A small ride of 5 minutes to the top is scenic and enjoyable. View from the Gun hill of the valley as well as himalayan range is spectacular provided the sky is clear. We had to stay there for approximately two hours for the clouds to clear to get the clear view of valleys and mountain peaks.A must visit if in Mussoorie.

title: Give it a miss
review: This is just another view point. You should rather take a small trek to some other place and give this a miss. It isn't a nice place at all. It is full of the honeymooners and families and it'll kill your vibe. I would prefer Lal Tibba over this.

title: Nice touristy viewpoint
review: The Gun Hill is easily accessibly by the rope way from e Mall near he rickshaw stand.

title: Great view
review: A great panoramic view of the Doon valley on one side and Himalayan range on the other side.  Worth a visit when in Mussorie. Ropeway to the Top is a Very favourite mode to the top with the tourists though walking to the Top is more adventurous

title: very good spot to enjoy
review: to get this place through cable car service with reasonable cost & this place is very good to stay 4-5 hours easily.... lot's to see & enjoy.....

title: Gun Hill is a lovely place.
review: Gun Hill is a lovely place for viewing beautiful Himalayan range and Doon Valley.    It is located at 400 ft above mall road and can be access by a cable car ( Rs. 100 per person ticket for cable car).

title: Ok Place, Good for Kids
review: We find this place a very normal place to visit in Mussoorie. Its a hill top with few shops to eat, few shops to play games and a few binoculars. The trek till gun hill is good, you would enjoy it. Ropeway is just ok, very very small journey.

title: Himalaya View and Games
review: It reminds me of my childhood with all those games in fair(Mela) like baloon shooting, throwing rings and get a gift. It was just amazing.

title: terrible
review: two ways to reach gun hill 1. roap way, 2. by walking when you reached every one ask you for photo which is very disturbing .

title: Not worth your time
review: So basically there are 2 ways to go to Gun Hill. One is through a road trek. And the other one is through rope way. During weekends the rope way has a long queue. Waiting time could be between 30 minutes to 2 hours (depending on the queue).

title: Great
review: Good place if you go walking nd not by the ropeway.. the views are breath taking and the entire mussoorie looks fabulous

title: Just an attraction but nothing attractive
review: enjoyed hiking with friends to  this place instead of enjoying the place more. Had maggi while spending a little time enjoying the mountain view. kis might enjoy this place with usual games of firing etc.

title: Not worth the walk
review: It's good exercise walking up but the incredible haze/pollution over the whole valley in mid-April is unfortunate.

title: not worth the visit
review: going by the electric ropeway has a charm but once you reach the top it is a bit of disappointment.too many shops and small restaurants spoil the beauty

title: The ropeway experience
review: To reach GunHill point you need to by a ticket of 100 rs for ropeway, you will experience a small ropeway journey and once at the top you have only nature to see all around you.

title: Average place
review: Just a hype of going to gun hill on rope way

title: Second Highest point at Mussorie
review: This spot is accessible by rope way from the cycle Rickshaw stand near Fountain on the Mall Road. The Rope way ride is enjoyable so is the spot. Better to visit nearer Sun set time so that you can have a beautiful view of the Doon valley and Sun set.

title: Straight from the heart of Mall Road
review: Once you are in the Mall Road in Mussoorie, one can take the cable car ride @ Rs 100/- per head to reach the Gun Hill, the second highest peak in Mussoorie..a beautiful view of the valley can be seen from the Top...Me and my two kids saw that there has been a long Q, decided to climb the hill....it was a 15 minute walk and climb..at sometime, it is steep...but we enjoyed the climb...once you are atop at Gunhill, there are numbers of restaurant and other shops...view of himalaya from Gun hill is also stunning provided the weather is good..we did a photo session with my little girl with traditional Garhwali dress with Mussoorie town in the backdrop...a cup of tea after climbing is very refreshing ....the cable car runs till night, may be upto 9 PM, from the busty corner in the Mall Road...however, going in the daytime is better to have a view of valley from the top which is stunning....

title: Great view
review: Gun hill is a must visit place in mussourie. Beautiful view of valleys will make ur day. Small ride in trolley over the mall road you will surely not want to miss.

title: Just exp ropeway
review: It s not that great when you reach up the point, as its more commercialize that really viewing and scenic out there.

title: One Time Visit
review: This point is not of much excitement and you must visit it only if you have excess time. It is located far from the city

title: Ropeway from Mall road
review: Gunhill can be reached through ropeway from Mall road... Person who love games like shooting or ring game.. This is the place... Good city view.

title: Don't waste your time
review: Visit this place if you haven't been on a ropeway trolley before in your life.

title: Sheer Wastage of Time. AVOID
review: Gun Hill is situated a few meters above the Mall Road and to reach there, you need to book a cable car ride. There is simply nothing exciting the ride as it is too short and the height it reaches is a mere joke.

title: No Gun No Fun
review: Gun Hill has nothing to offer save some views ( if its a clear day).  The ropeway from Mall road ascends to the top ( about 250 M) and gives you a cooler view.  The top is crowded with shops of tea and snacks and the usual activity ones ( rifle shooting).

title: Nice trip on a cold rainy evening
review: Took the rope way on a cold rainy afternoon. Rs 129 per head for a 2 mins ride looked a little steep. Sunny afternoon rides would probably be worth it.

title: Top view
review: If you are first time then this is a must visit place. If weather is clear then visit this place. Gives very good view of mountains and doon valley.

title: Better to avoid
review: If you love trekking on a cemented path or if you are the one who loves to tick the place you have visited or you want a cable car ride over buildings then do go but otherwise forget about it. The Gun Hill top is a cemented flat ground with hordes of shops selling games like ring throw or balloon shooting and few dirty cafes. But for a nature lover it is a complete no no.

title: Not much to do. Old dirty ropeway
review: We went to Gun Hill for the ropeway ride. As usual it was very crowded and we had to make advance booking for the ropeway, which was in a very bad shape, luckily for us we were transported back safely.

title: view
review: place very average, but if in mussoorie then one must go up there and atleast have a great vew of the hills. shops have nothing interesting. but atleat you can enjoy maggi and coffee at the highest point  which on  edge of the gun hill.

title: Horribly crowded
review: Just a small ride to see the view which can be seen from below also. Not worth standing in the long queue

title: In the Midst of Clouds
review: Gun Hill point is one of the BEST place to visit in Mussourie. It has scenic beauty and gives you feel of being in Clouds. It is better to visit during daytime before 2 PM because mostly after that visibility drops

title: Had Fun on Roap way
review: Nice Place to visit in the market. road way is fun part. lot of food joints and shops available. looks beautiful in winter.

title: An Aerial View of the Doon Valley
review: An Aerial View of the Doon Valley

title: Not worth the visit!
review: Gun Hill is very near Club Mahindra resort where we stayed. We didn't have to spend any efforts to reach the place. However, Gun Hill was a disappointment. It neither offer a good view nor it is well maintained. It has just few shops selling basic items.It is worth only if one wants to try the Rope Way.

title: Not worth
review: The ropeway isnt that exciting here as expected. Otherwise so-so place which can be skipped. Need to go by rick

title: Gun hill views
review: Breathtaking views from this place. Its a second highest peak of Mussourie and provides 360 degrees views of Himalayan ranges. Views are to die for!

title: Good views
review: Interestingly named, breathtaking views of the mountains from here. Large enough to not seem crowded with other tourists too.

title: Standard games but still enjoyable
review: Main attraction of course is the ride in the cable car. But once on the Hill, you still do enjoy many games, photo sessions in different dresses and other attractions!

title: Gun Hill
review: Suppose to be the highest peak in Mussoorie. There is not much of natural beauty there. One can see few snow capped peaks form the hill. Children can play games

title: Not worth a visit
review: Frankly, I cannot think of one reason why one should go here apart from the view, which can be had from other places in Mussoorie also. Hopeless waste of time. Skip this place, if you can

title: Nice View Point with too much Commercialisation
review: It is second highest peak of Mussoorie and has nice view point. You can take ropeway to reach their and enjoy coffee and Maggie with nice hill view. However, this place is not maintain. Whole point is crowded with shops who are trying to sell you everything. It is best place for first timers/weeekenders in Mussoorie. Avoid it if you are staying more than one day. There are better place to visit.

title: Gun Hill cable ride
review: It's a waste of time going for a cable ride up the Gun Hill. All you see is a view of Doon valley from just a bit higher elevation!

title: 2nd highest peak in mussoorie
review: from mall road you can reach there by rope way , fee is 120 per person , you can see mussoorie from different direction .

title: Good If u treck, Nothing on hill, Just shops
review: Can be ignored

title: Not worth
review: Not really maintained well ...As it can be kept much cleaner and better?............not really worth in fact enjoyed jharipani waterfall for trekking.....

title: Ropeway to Gun Hill
review: Gun Hill is the second highest point of Mussoorie.you will get to enjoy a panoramic view of this scenic hill station & Doon Valley. A land of nature’s treasure, indeed!

title: Top of the Mall and ropeway
review: This place is around the mall and accessible by ropeway. there is another road to reach the spot but its recommended to go by ropeway. ropeway ride is very nice and view is scenic. Once you are in the spot there are many stalls for games and food. there is a small spot for viewing mountains.

title: No views at all.
review: So what you can see at the Gun Hill is just shops and restaurants which you can see on the Mall road.

title: Snow Point of Mussorie
review: Its also called Snow Point of Mussorie, There were 2 ways to reach Gun Hill, either you walk for 1 hour from Mall Road and reach the Gun Hill or You can opt for Rope Way, that starts Mall Road near Queen Hill Hotel.

title: Complete disappointment!
review: What could have been a superb viewpoint is completely spoiled by commercialisation. To reach here, you have to use a cable car, which is charged at 100 INR per person. Eateries and gift shops cover the entire place. There is no proper maintenance or cleanliness, all the garbage has been thrown down the valley. The place is supposed to be of historic importance, but looking at the way it is maintained, I am not sure the government has done anything to preserve it. Total waste of time & money.

title: Crowded
review: We went around 10 AM so there wasn't a line for the tickets to go up. 100₹ each. Up you have a nice view in some spots without a shop. Some shops and restaurants were open but not clean and the shopkeepers were really obtrusive. Finally we walked down the hill what took around 10 minutes.

title: Good place to bask in sun
review: I took my all the friends along with kids  ... the weather was bright and sunny ... and only the continuous breeze helped us sit under the sun... our families had great time and kids also enjoyed

title: Gun hill with the camel's back rock
review: As the history goes that on this mountain top the British placed their big gun and now it has become a tourist spot from where one can view the entire Mussoorie. The cable car ferries the tourists there from the mall road but the walking up option too is available. There are some small eating stalls and recreation stalls out there. Just a little below the gun hill lies the camel's back rock which actually appears like the hunch of a camel.

title: Gunhill - 5 minutes through ropeway
review: There isn't much to do at the top. Some food stalls & some game stalls, along with few photography options.

title: Good
review: Just ordinary,kids or Young ones may enjoy. One can avoid and save money to spend some other activities.

title: Nothing to do
review: The gun hill has nothing you say nothing to write or to enjoy

title: Waste of money
review: Rope way is waste of money, when u go up on rope way u cannot see anything as the glass on the rope way are broken and sticked with salo tape rope way is old needs replacement and they charge RS 100 not at all worth

title: One time visit
review: There is nothing at Gun hill that really distinguishes it from other points in Mussorie. Sure it has great views but the same can be had at other places without the Rs 100/- charge. But if one has some extra time on hand then it's good for a one time visit.

title: Second Highest Point
review: Offering amazing views of the Doon Valley and the hills, the rope way is a great way to reach Gun Hill. The more fit can trek to the peak.

title: A good while away !!
review: There is not much to do on 'Gun Hill' for adults. if you're with a kid or a larger group that has kids...please do visit. There are few eateries, activity shops, games & activities like shooting balloons, archery etc.

title: Good place to hangout
review: You have to go there by a ropeway. You'll have to wait for around 10-15 minutes for your turn and the wait for the ride back is even more ( around 25-30 minutes).

title: Fun Activities
review: NicePlace to go to via a rope way. Not much to do except sit and watch the view from a nice seat and munch on snacks.

title: Good view of the valley
review: Gun hill point located in the centre of the mall road is a fairly busy and well visited sight seeing point. You have to take a rope way from the mall road which takes you to the point. The operator charges 100 Rs. per person for To and Fro journey. Be prepared to stand in queue since there is only 1 ropeway each ways and in can take some time for your turn to come. The ropeway route is not too exciting since all you get to see is hotel balconies and windows. On reaching the top you find the entire area surrounded by food and game joints. All possible view points have been captured by the food joints and you need to occupy tables to enjoy the view. The place only has a couple of open view points one facing Dehradun valley and the other facing Himalayas. The view offered at both the points was majestic and was the only plus point of the visit.

title: Top of Hiils
