review: Gun hill is top hill of Mussoorie and one can go by rope way as well as on foot from near court complex,one can also see old water storage tank of english times days from water was supplied to city.It is better to go by rope way n return by foot n enjoy nature

title: Hill Top
review: It is a place from where you can see the entire Mussoorie, it is named as gun hill as in British times a fire was used in the evening to inform the people that the time is 5 PM the gun is still there and it is a nice tourist attraction.

title: Not worth it
review: Its not worth going there and On top it has some shops and no proper view also. And the area is also not clean.

title: View only visit once
review: So I have been to Mussoorie this week only where I have visited Gun Hill.

title: Top of world experience
review: Its a peak near Mussoori town.

title: Only if you want to try the ropeway
review: The Gun Hill has a lot of hype amongst visitors however once you are there, it's not worth the hype. You can surely try visiting just in case you want to try the ropeway, it's cool that ways. You will only find a few local food points at the top that's all.

title: Gun hill
review: The ride up and down to Gun Hill was ok but on reaching the top was very disappointing as it is totally ruined by shabby cafes and small vendors ruining any view of the scenery that could have been enjoyed

title: A typical tourist attravtion
review: The only good thing about Gun Hill is the cable car trip which is very enjoyable - and the breathtaking view from Gunhill once you reach the top.

title: Above Average For Enjoy
review: It is above average place for enjoy. You can enjoy good scenic view from there and also can use binocular to enjoy long mountain range and glaciers.

title: Can be missed
review: Gun hill as the name suggests used to have a canon which used to be fired to help locals know it's afternoon. However due to some mishaps they got rid of it.

title: Nice Visit
review: It is a cool place, where you can find some respite from the hyper activity of Mall Road Mussoorie. It has an excellent view of the valley. It is splendid by the four telescopes at the top. Overall nice visit

title: highly commercial place
review: the place on top of mountain is now blocked by shops on all sides..on your way up in trolley you can see trash mounds..very disappointing

title: Cheap Cable Car and commercial
review: The Cable car is a closed one which takes you above the hotels in mussorie. The gun hill point has some stupid tourist and games to waste time. there s telescope view which is again waste of time. Avoid going here if you are not with kids. Cable car is the only attraction. Instead visit the open able car and much better service in Haridwar Mansa devi temple

title: Top most point
review: We visited on a chilly cold evening. Cable car ride was good. good scenic view. Could not spend time as the last cable car was leaving. Should go with at least couple of hours in hand

title: Feels like a commercial fairground
review: Thoroughly disappointed. One of the best view point on Mussoorie is completely crowded with cheap shops and eateries. Hardly there are space to stand quietly. You need to take a old rickety roapway to reach there. Ride cost Rs. 100 per person. You can see the Himalasn snow pick if there is no fog.

title: No attraction...
review: We reached the place through rope way. The place had nothing to offer excepting for a few photographers, games stalls (archery, aiming baloons etc like in school fete). Unkempt tea stalls... you can visit for rope way and reaching close to nature.

title: gun hill
review: a ropeway on the mall road takes you to Gun hill from where you can get a skyline view of the whole city of mussoorie. with tickets priced at rs 100 per person, this is a great way to soak in the nature of the hills.

title: Good Views, not much to do
review: Good place since it is the 2nd highest point of Mussorie.

title: Nothing much!
review: Dissapointing.. All commercialized that too only 1* commercialization.. Poor maintained swings for kids.. Trolley ride was interesting only for kids.. Nothing much to say!! Poor..

title: Scenery is beautifull for the top
review: It was close to our hotel and we travel there by Rope way.  from there we can see the Himalayan Range covered with snow

title: Good scenic beauty from top..
review: The place offers good scenic view of entire mussorie city and also the hills; which provides some opportunity to have great pictures..

title: An average tourist spot
review: Gun hill is situated at some good height from the Mall road so need a rope-way cable car to reach the spot. 100 rupees for a round trip journey per head is kind of reasonable, however on the Gun Hill there is not much to do... Site seeing and some games like hoopla, balloon shooting, archery, magic tricks and snack shacks is all that is available.

title: Demotivated
review: Hi Folks, I have visited this place this January, and totally disappointing The place is very unclean, full of shops and people use to drink hard drinks there openly in front of "Shanimata" temple. I have asked a local shop owner and he replied that the shop owner association is involved in all these activities. Scenic beauty is absent due to lot of shops. No maintenance.

title: Ahhh... the views from atop the hill
review: There is a ropeway that can be used to go up to the top. The views from the top of Gun hill are amazing.

title: Avoidable..
review: All you get up here is some average view of the mountains and a bunch of MELA kind of stalls. Don't gamble on your shooting skills there.

title: spectacular view
review: One can reach Gun bill by walk as well as cable car.walking is very difficult.even elders are not advised to go by walk.From peak can see all the view.

title: Good view
review: Too many shops around, hampering your views.

title: Gun hill
review: from mall road there are two option either one can climb up to gun hill or there is ropeway which takes 5-7 minutes. The fee for ropeway is 100 rupees per person. on reaching gunhill there are few sundry shops/ games/ fancy dress photographers shops. Not much of eatery options.

title: Waste of time
review: This place is not worth spending time and charges for the rope way is too high for this point. Nothing to do on the hill point.

title: Himalayan view is awesome from here
review: Hi fellow travellers, you can take ropeway trolley from Mall road(100/person) and reach to Gun Hill, in between enjoy the valley view from ropeway. One Mata mandir is situated over the hill. There are lot of eating options. For pic lovers it's a must visit place. View of Himalayan mountain range ia very vivid from top.

title: Nothing so awesome
review: Only good thing on this place is reaching through ropeway which you can enjoy. Else on top its more about shops and can view mountains. Can view all this while reaching Mussoorie hills though bus or car.

title: SHAM
review: If you wanna waste money on trolley ride then go ahead and visit gunhill because there is nothing else to do there

title: Fun ride to reach this place
review: One can reach this place by walking as well as ropeway by paying 100 rupees per person. It is a beautiful view points. One can view snow capped peaks from here, do shopping, eat street food. There is small shani and parvati mandir here.

title: Damn high
review: A historical and second highest peak of Mussoorie, Gun Hill is favourite place for viewing pictursque in the himalyan ranges

title: Nice view of Himalaya
review: Can only reach by rope way, its also a good experience.

title: Nice view!
review: Second highest peak in mussorrie. Its located in the mall road.This place can be reached only by cable car which takes around 10 mins to drop you over there leaving the queue time. Ticket price is

title: Commercialization has killed it.
review: Commercialization has killed it. all around the platform there are numerous shops and shacks selling bangles to magic to what not. They have blocked the view completely. You are left with a few 2 feet wide gaps to have a look at the valley. The back side , near the toilet offers a better view of the snow clad lower Himalayas. I am severely disappointed as my memories from twenty years back was a quiet hill top with few vendors and an exquisite sunset.

title: Good view point
review: t is located on the Mall Road. One can take the Ropeway to reach the top of the Gun Hill. View of Mussoorie from top is beautiful. One can have food from the small restaurants situated there.

title: Awesome view
review: I visited just before sunset time. 30 seconds to sun hiding behind the fogs and cloud. Better than an airplane view in winter

title: Beautiful View
review: The place is one of the most famous places to visit in Mussorie. Can be reached by Ropeway. Beautiful Himalayan Ranges covered in snow are a must-watch !

title: Tacky tourist trap
review: What a shame. What would once have been a lovely spot has been totally overtaken by a crowded mess of tin shacks selling souvenirs and snacks. The view itself has almost completely been obscured. Far better to take a walk up to Lal Tibba and enjoy an uninterrupted 360 view from there.

title: Just a Place To Kill Time
review: Good place for families with young kids. There are a few 'dhabas' to cater to your hunger. Remember to keep the kids covered as the weather changes at anytime and the place being on a hill top has chilly winds blowing that may make them sick.

title: Don't waste your time!
review: There's absolutely nothing about this place. It claims to be a view point, but the views aren't anything different from what you can see from the Mall Road itself. The only different thing is the Ropeway ride you take from the Mall road to reach this place. it costs 100/ticket for this ropeway and it takes about 5 mins in to&fro.

title: Second highest point in Mussoorie
review: Pointers:

title: Probably the best place in Musoorie
review: So the way to reach the top is cable car which is 5-minute fun ride. Once you reach there, you will have a small market with few restro. I will recommend you to go in the first half of the December if you can, as this will be not peak time, everything will be cheap and vendors will be super nice to you.

title: Himalayan view
review: This is one of the places in Mussoorie which provides a view to the Himalayan ranges.

title: it's a nice place.. the walk downhill is great . the rope way travel to gunhill is fun ...
review: great location but overcrowded with shops. the views from some spots are amazing. in treating food options available. use track down from gunhill to the mall.

title: a much visit place
review: the rope way is a thrilling experience and also the view from the top is excellent and mind blowing, do carry your binoculars to enjoy the sight seeing of himalayan range and  far away snow clad mountains, climate changes as its on top and do carry all your winter goodies to keep you warm

title: Food & activities
review: The place is very well located and has lovely views of sunrise and sunset. Requires better planning and maintenance. The ropeway link is good but the same needs to be made open both ways in terms of ticket purchase and start point of the journey.

title: Very unusual
review: We had to wait for around 20 mins just to get on the gondola to get on top of the gun hill ..but when we got there the place was really scenic and nice , thou I fell that they could have made the place more nice in terms of their restaurants and the small shops ..they have a place where they will show you the ten points in Mussoorie..which was nice !! Really enjoyed it

title: Provides amazing view of Himalayas
review: We had been to this point in the rope-way available from Mall road. This is a picturesque spot which gives a beautiful view of himalayan ranges and overall Mussorie surroundings.

title: superb views of the himalayas
review: this point offers great views of the entire valley and the himalayas.

title: Must to visit
review: Must visit place at least once in your life time. Amazing view of snow capped peaks. Once can also enjoy capturing some pictures in local attire.

title: Only for rope way ride
review: Although the gun hill point does not have much to offer, i would recommend the rope way ride, which takes you up to the gun hill point. The rope way offers a all round view of Mussoorie and valley. However, the ride could have been better, if the windows of the rope way car were clearer and uncracked. Once you reach the point, you have a lot of shops selling souvenirs, snacks and games.

title: Disappointment
review: We reached the Gun hill point through Cable car. Once when we reached the top could only see shops all 360 degress. Beautiful view of the mountains completely blocked. Was just waste of time visiting this place.

title: No Guns - Lots of 'shops'
review: What is quite often described as a must see - visit location in Mussooire was given a pass by me the past decade or so when I have visited this area.  Today I thought I would check it out if only to 'get my ticket punched' on the attraction, as it were.   Having hiked the old trail up from Rajpur the previous day the vertical stairs up looked nothing more than a common sight along the trail of yesterday.  While I have some 7 decades behind me the up is not for some, though the younger generation might want to consider the 'climb up'.  At the top we have another shameful example of a potential dustbin in the making.   The ubiquitous small shops and these would be popular with kids.  The view today was enhanced by the clarity of the air to the north, thus making it possible to see those wonderful snow capped mountains we know as the Himalayan mountain range.  Gun hill should have a gun, well perhaps a rusty old canon will suffice.

title: another cramped market on the top of Mussoorie
review: you need to stand in a long queue of ropeway to reach gunhill....which might take anywhere between half an hiur to 2 hours depending upon rush

title: Good climb, but nothing so great about the hill
review: 500 m climb from Mall Road is a good trek, but on reaching the top, its just a few shops selling food and clothes. View from the top is just okay.

title: nothing much to do except ropeway ride
review: the ropeway ride which cost 100  INR for up and down journey is the best way to go Gun Hill.

title: Ropeway and the Gun hill
review: The only attraction is that you reach Gun Hill through the rope way. Journey in the rope way is a nice experience but nothing much to see at the gun hill point.

title: Not Wheelchair freindly place, Car Parking is Available at 1 Km
review: It is good sight and can be added to top Five attractions of Mussoorie, however not advisable for old people who can not walk more than half Km. Wheel chair can not be accessible. However it gives good view point for the top.

title: Trip
review: You can get a nice view of Mussoorie once u reach the top...provided there ain't any fog/clouds...so you have be there quite early in the morning....we were unfortunate....so cudnt see much...

title: Go for the Ropeway ride
review: The Ropeway will take you to the Gun Hill from where you can have scenic views of the mountains. Apart from this, there are few eateries and shops. Nothing so great about it. Adventure tourists can climb instead of taking the Ropeway.

title: Nice view point
review: A cable car ride takes you to this historic place. The ride costs Rs 75. They have telescope and you can see the snow capped Himalayas. But unfortunately it was foggy and we could not see anything

title: Shun the rope car and walk your way up
review: I took a walk up the hill and was very happy with my decision. On any given day you need to wait an hour to get an entry to rope car. The uphill is not for elders though. At the top of the hill, it's a flat surface with lot of shops, old canon and a water tank. Don't have a lot of expectations. You get a good view of the town from top. Not a must visit

title: Gun hill
review: Its on the top of Mussoorie. Cable car is available.... also can walk on foot. Doon valley on 1 side and Himalayan range on the other side is awesome view.

title: Good point to get a snap of Mussoorie town from top
review: Take a ropeway and go to Gunpoint. It's a good point to get a snap of Mussoorie town from top. Only cons, there are too much shops there which I don't like.

title: Waste of timr
review: Only good thing about this is that you can view the city from height. But wasn't good from the budget prospect. Hiring ropeway after 1 hr line and then going up for nothing special is just pain. But telescope view is the only best thing yet it is little expensive

title: Scenic views!
review: The climb through cable car is steep. The view from this place is fantastic. The distant Himalayan ranges add to the beauty.

title: Same story -- over commercialization
review: What a waste you can witness here of such a great place!!

title: 100 bucks for a overhyped ropeway.
review: You pay 100₹ for a ropeway which hardly carries you around 300m on top of a hill which is a terrace with views not having anything to boast about. There are a dozen tea shops , lots of trinkets and many many games stalls(why???) and magic tricks stalls. A disappointing journey for the price paid.

title: Just go up and have some scenic view only
review: For Gun hill, u ll have to go thru tram and spend some money on it as well as lot of waiting time u ll have to face.

title: average place
review: the place is at top of mussorie and thats the only point for going there else one may remove from their itinerary. hiring a ropeway is nothing special.

title: Nothing Much to see
review: Except for the cable car ride there is nothing much of interest in Gun Hill. There are plenty of small tea stalls and games shops. Also sellers of typical tourist stuff.

title: A small escape at top
review: a great small escape at top of the hill a very exciting rope way trolley available to go and come back at the cost of 100 per person, some good activities at the top too.

title: Not an exceptional place in Mussurie
review: this is just an average tourist attraction. Being on the top of the hill you can have good views. The worst part is the place is not neatly managed and there are a lot of hawkers asking you for the binocular views of 7 pints and so on. There are few eating places with very average quality of service and food.

title: No purpose but weather and fair games
review: The only way to get there is via Ropeway and once you reach there, you become the captive audience of the local gamewala's who are good at offering you games. Felt like a games court with limited options, but we liked it there. You won't regret visiting this place. Good for 1 hour of your time.

title: Spectacular View From Gunhill !
review: You can reach Gunhill through Ropeway which is at the mid of the mall road. Views are really awesome .Lots of shops are selling souvenirs , games , snacks. There is an open Shani Temple. Be careful about having food there as the quality & taste is not up to the mark. Only maggi and coffee is fine.

title: Just like Treking
review: A little bit experience of trekking on going up the hill 500 metres and Rope way facility is also there.

title: Good only for the view you get from top
review: its takes 15 mins walk from the library chowk or 10 mins by rickshaw ride of Rs 50 for 2, to reach their List trolly area , charging 200 for a couple , for a height if just 5 mins and on top there are normal stalls like in exhibitions to play and tea stalls and take view thats all,  you can also avoid the lift if you wish by climbing up the hill on your own.

title: Nothing to see or miss
review: the only attraction to place is the cable car, that too is a bit scary to be honest. one can just go up for a cup of tea

title: nice view
review: You will enjoy being here. You can reach here by both the means, either by walk(which is tiring) or by the rope-way.

title: An Average Place
review: Enjoy the cable car ride to and from the place. Apart from that not much to do or see once you reach there.

title: Waste of time
review: View has been blocked by stalls of eateries and kid games. Looks like Maggie has taken over the place. Dirty, unhygienic food. Cable car is   In Pathetic  condition . Waste of time & money, one is left wondering ,what is the tourism department doing about it.

title: Good view of the valley
review: You have to take a 500 m ride in Rope way from Mall Road to reach on top of Gun hill. The view of the valley from Gun hill was serene. There are a few shops where you can enjoy nice Maggie and Chai along with the pleasant view and breeze. Ideal time to visit this place will be in the evening during sunset.

title: Average
review: When you reach there you find nothing exciting.  Most of good ppoints have been encroached by shopkeepers so you have to enter shop to view sights.

title: Very commercialized but the views are great!
review: I went up here by cable car. The cable car costs 100 Rs for a round trip (keep your ticket as you will also need to show it on your way back). I had to queue up and took almost 40 mins before I got to ride in the cable car (you can also hike up here from the road just ahead of the cable car). I was expecting a nice open place with great views, but I found that there were shops all around and hardly a place to stand and enjoy the view. I had to navigate behind the shops to view an AMAZING sunset. There are many fast food shops where you can grab quick bites up here.

title: awesome scenic view
review: if you want to see natures beauty ..this is it ..go to this palce and get mesmarised with the place .it is one pf the best place with some food joints

title: Gun Hill View Point
review: The only attraction attached to it is the cable care ride taking you to some place at a high altitude. This builds up the excitement & suspense however once you reach there, you will find eating joints and lot of games stalls. So invoke the child in you & play some games...not much to do. On a clear day, you may get some view too.

title: View Point
review: If you are lucky to have a clear sky, then you can witness one of the great views from this view point overlooking Dehradun Valley.

title: Yet another place
review: The only thing great about the place is nothing. It is like being on any nice hill top. The good thing is the rope-way if you have not ever been on it.

title: Perfect Ride
review: A ride from mall road to top of Hill, you will get amazing views and also sit n relax for 1-2 hrs as lots of food options are there . you can sit inside these small restaurants situated at the top and get nice valley views. Cost (100 Rs.)

title: Journey is better than destination
review: For best experience travel by foot and don't take the trolly. Also don't expect some amazing view from top.

title: Good Place for Photography
review: Go by walk instead of taking ropeway. Do have a traditional dress for fotos rented out der. There are plenty of foodies; though all fast food. Must carry umbrella as rain comes anytime.

title: Better try at Sahasradhara
review: instead of trying here better you can trey the same at sahasradhara near dehradun.This will be much better than the one in mussoorie. :)

title: Waste of time
review: Don't bother taking the gondola up to gun hill. Nothing here except for arcade games and cheap restaurants

title: Waste of time
review: No need to go there. It has only shops and all area is fully covered by shops. No place to enjoy. Spend full day in Company Garden instead of Gun Hill

title: Mesmarizing Views
review: Second highest peak of valley. Provide 360 degree view of Himalaya. about 25 walking distance from mall road. can be reached by rope way

title: very awesome place for nature lover
review: this place is on mall road very good palace nice view points and good hotels and shops

title: Not best time of year to get views
review: Steep walk up to Gun Hill or you can take the cable car. We walked up and you need a good level of fitness to do this or else take your time. Unfortunately due to the time of year (July) we had poor visibility of the view and were disappointed we did not get to see the Himalayan foothills clearly. Location is 2000 metres high and we were literally up amongst the clouds. There are shops up at Gun Hill but most seemed very touristic.

title: Good place
review: Please do visit this place it is good place of mussoorie and without visiting it in ropeway it is totally a waste of mussoorie trip.

title: Nice place
review: Beautiful view. Can be reached by cable car /ropeway. The queue to ropeway is very long so plan accordingly. In addition to clicking pics, we could buy many gift items, toys etc here

title: Gun Hill, Mussoorie
review: The second highest point in Mussoorie. Its the favorite and popular view point for visitors.Visitors can reach by there cable car also.

title: Not so great
review: You take cable car as it is being listed as one of the attractions in Mussoorie but neither me, my wife nor my son enjoyed it as the cable car just passes through concrete buildings. Its crowded with upto 10 passengers. The ones in Haridwar are far more better. The shops over the top are again of no use.

title: Must Avoid Place
review: Local Taxi Package definitely include and take to this place to complete their quota of rides and time period.

title: A waste of money
review: The ropeway trip to the Gun Hill was very disappointing. The cable car which takes you uphill to the Gun Hill is poorly maintained and very dirty. And when you reach Gun Hill you realize there is nothing that captivates you. The place is dotted with shops that haven't changed in the last twenty years. The shops have mushroomed in such a manner that there is no view that one can enjoy of the valley. Shopkeepers urging tourists for photographs in dirty old costumes and offering tea and maggi is not my idea of a scenic spot. The government/ authorities need to upgarde the place and definitely need to look at the hygiene. Never going back. Not worth  it.

title: hopeless
review: If you have time and energy to waste then this is the place for you. There is just nothing. If you love hiking then it's fine.

title: Mussoorie view from Top.
review: Gun hill as its name suggest is a hill which was used by Indian military to use there big guns. Now this place is tourists point. To go on this hill best way is to buy tickets of tram which work from middle of mall road. On the top there are restaurants, shops and many points to take a view of whole Mussoorie. Temperature falls a little when you reach on the hill. There is telescope point where you can watch far away with a telescope. Try drinking hot cup of tea/coffee and eat hot maggie.

title: Nothing much on top
review: The top of Gun Hill is full of small shops all around with hardly any views of the valleys below. You might catch a glimpse of the valley from rare viewpoints and grab a bite. The ropeway ride is nice though. Be prepared for waiting for an hour in busy season.

title: Waste of time
review: They have only two trolleys which transports the passengers on the ropeway. Waiting time 30-45 mins from one side. There is nothing much at the top. Better u can save these 2-3 hours and visit some amazing sites like George Everest, Cloud end and Santura Devi Temple. Gun Hill is a waste of time & energy for those who are on a short trip.

title: Safe View!
review: A nice place for view if you are not adventurous. Protected, Safe and crowded. The rope-way is good.

title: So so place.
review: No big atraction, only fun part is travelling on a trolley and reaching the palce.

title: only nice place in peak season
review: after getting tired in huge lines for ropeway we reached gunhill, Its really chilly with strong wind felt awesome, there are self serviced swings for kids and some photo props..... had pakode chai and maggi at a corner restaurant near view point ... it was great.

title: sight seeing
review: it is high and we can go there by trolly or on road..the view lovers go there to enjoy nature beauty

title: Gun Hill Point
review: Not very much to offer. Yes but there is a shani devta temple located in this top point. You can visit this point if your children just want to enjoy the trolley ride

title: Time Waste
review: The cable car view was good but the view is obstructed by commercial establishments .It is good on a sunny day but there are only a few places on the top from where you get an unobstructed view .Good walk though.

title: Boring place
review: Waste of time and waste of money, this place is so boring there is nothing to do all you can do is just roam around and come back.

title: Spot with three beautiful views
review: This is the place in Mussoorie where you will have three views.

title: Nothing interesting except the rope way
review: Journey by rope way is exciting but the top of gun hill is not having any eye catching spot. Only fun activities like shooting or archery can be done

title: Very good view of Himalaya's
review: This is one of the place where you will get a very good view of himalaya's, here you can reach by ropeway which cost merely rs. 100/- per person, there are many shops where you can entertain yourself with games and food.

title: Misty Air ay GUN HILL
review: You will feel like you are in heaven. Ropeway ride is also amazing. Eatery shops add fun to all this.

title: Now equivalent to Club Mahindra
review: This is no longer a view point. It is now given to club mahindra, which is an awesome group of resorts. View from this place is awesome.

title: Time pass place
review: Nothing much to do here except indulging in fast food and you can also view far off places from telescopic binoculars. Kids would love the place. But wait time to take a cable trolley is a pain.

title: The top
review: The top most place in the town with short rope way .once you reach the top you can enjoy the views but commercial surrounding makes it less fun

title: Hill top commercialized
review: Earlier Gun Hill used to be a point from where you could enjoy the beauty of himalayas.

title: Good view
review: Its a good view of city from gun hills. If its fog day then you will miss the view and if its clear day then you will enjoy. You can reach to gun hill by using rope way.

title: Great ride up to the top of the hill - nice view !
review: The main reason why you should go to Gun Hill is not the Hill - it is the ropeway.

title: Bad! Time Waste!
review: No views! Totally commercialized! The one good thing is rope way which lasts only about 2-3 minutes.

title: must do with kids
review: its a nice fun place. the cable car ride is quite nice and the place at the top of the hill is fun to spend a1-2 hours. Its clean with decent toilet facilities. There are stalls for food and games for kids (the diwali mela kind of games like rifle shooting, hoopla) andsome photograh shops that will dress you up like a king or queen and give you a photo for Rs 100.

title: Nothing special here
review: You can just enjoy going through rope way here, if you have haven't experienced rope way earlier. On gun hill, there is nothing to enjoy expect few good views.

title: GUN HILL WITH NO CHARM
review: visited Gun Hill but it has lost the charm as almost all shops are of photography and no good restaurant.

title: Nothing more to see
review: This is the top most place in the town, but surrounded by commercial establishments. The same view you get from the mall road.

title: Excllent view from top
review: The CAble car ride is nice. after reaching top, sudenly u see dip in temp. from top u can see the entire mussoorie and Dehradoon town. visit the place in the evening...twilight time.  u can enjoy maggie and tea with valley facing view. u can view china border and himalayan range from here in clear skies. Nice place. Avoid it on Saturdays and Sundays ....too Crowded.

title: good view if early in morning
review: this is the place to be visited in mussoorie, but make sure to come in a bit early in the morning to really enjoy the views, we were fortunate enough to get whole place to ourselves, & dress up in the local costumes with lot of photographs, on the way back the line was very very big. so later in the day i can only imagine the crowd

title: Nice views all around Gun Hill
review: There are two ways to reach Gun Hill.

title: View entire Mussorie
review: On the sunny day, you can view the entire valley. There are telescopes, that will make you see the various points of Mussorie including Lal Tibba, Sachin Tendulkar's house, Naag devta temple, St. George etc. It is completely commercialized otherwise.

title: A hard climb but a rewarding view
review: Gun hill is at an elevation of about 400ft from the mall road. There is a ropeway also that goes till the top but you will have to wait in line for a while. I decided to hike to the top. The road is good, but it is very steep. Take some breaks in between the climb. Once you reach the top you can enjoy some good views and cool breeze. There are some places to eat, shop or play games. You can also dress in traditional clothes and have your picture taken. Do climb down before it's dark. And if you are not staying at Mussoorie and going back by bus make sure you are at the ticket counter by 4:30 or you may not get seats in d last bus at 6.

title: Excellent
review: Gun hill is the second largest valley in mussorie... There are many hotels located at the foot of this hotel...There is also a facility of ropeway to enjoy the weather and view from the top of the peak..

title: Gun hill
review: You have to go here by cable car from mall road exact opposite of hotel mall Palace.Not worth wasting one full hour except one want to enjoy cable ride(gandola).

title: Good for short time fun
review: You can reach here by using ropeways. Here some other fun activity also avilable. So its good place to visit.

title: Nice place to experience ropeway and hangout
review: nice place to hangout for few hours. great ropeway experience. its a high peak having shops and eateries shops.

title: good place with lots of options to enjoy
review: nice rope way journey to reach there, given full look of Mussoorie and near by places. Lots of games and shopping options.

title: Nothing Exciting.
review: Just a hill near mall road, Very large queue for Charlift to go to Gun Hill, Not so exciting. If you have time then only go to that place.

title: Top View
review: its a very nice place to see whole mussoori from the top. cable car is use to reach there.weather is really good on top.

title: Gun Hill
review: Most suitable for the children. There are some food stalls, Game stalls for children and 2-3 shopping stalls.

title: Good
review: This is the second highest point in Mussoorie and it was walk-able distance for me as I was staying at the highest room of Club Mahindra and I just had to do a small walk to reach this point. There is a Cable car which is an added attraction to visit this point  but do check their timings.

title: Decent family outing place in mussoorie
review: As compared to few years back Gun hill is not that attractive a place that it used to be. But still a decent place to hangout with family and friends as we had the option to use the fly car and get our photographs clicked in different costumes on paid basis.

title: Flat hill top
review: Generally hill tops are stiff ,pyramidal. However Mussoorie Gun Hill top is flat. I can't say whether this is natural or man-made. Since climbing this hill by stairs is tiresome ,one Travel Company has installed ropeway service from the Mall to the top of the hill.Now a days various entertainment programs  take place there.Shops .eateries are there to satisfy the craze and hunger of the tourists respective ly.After spending a few hours they come back by ropeway gondolas.Nice place for children to enjoy.

title: ropeway.
review: well the ropeway from jhula ghar is nice,but gun hill was ok, very average. The games and the food are very mediocre.

title: Good place, view if amazing.
review: One of the main attraction in Mussoorie and quite good. Use Trolley to reach there but if you want to go by walk give it a try, if was painful but amazing experience. View from that height is awesome, try to go in evening and stay till sunset and see mussoorie in night :)

title: A peaceful night view
review: Gun hill point on mall road is very peaceful n is at a good height. One should surely visit it at both the time : the night for the beautiful view and ofcourse during day for the market at that level of height.

title: Nice & chilling weather
review: Very nice place to reach out with the help of Trolley. Impressive & chilling wave requires warm clothes that too in summer season.

title: great valley view
review: expect a good 30-40mins wait on the rope way for your turn to visit gun hill.. Its a huge ground on the top with a lot of eateries and games for the kids.. The views from there are breathtaking and having a Maggie there adds to the fun !

title: Shoddy and nothing to see
review: The only decent thing about this is the ropeway ride to the top. Even that is a bit costly at Rs 100 for a round trip per person. The coaches are badly maintained and quite dirty. Once you reach the top, there is nothing to do. There are shops all around blocking all the view that might have been there. The shops themselves are quite tacky. As soon as you reach the top, you want to go down...its that bad. Avoidable.

title: Nice Mussoorie View
review: Gun Hill is accessible by rope-way or you may walk from a mall road. It provides few fun-games, shopping options and eating-points. You get a beautiful Mussoorie view from the Gun Hill.

title: Offers a good view of the valley
review: Can be reached by the ropeway on the Mall Road. Offers a good view of the valley below. During summers, the mist envelops the place and can cloud the views. One would have to wait for this to clear, else can feel disappointed.

title: Only good for view and cold breeze
review: You reach gunhill by the famous ropeway... Or if you are the adventurous kind then you can even trek to the point.

title: good placefor overview of Mussorie
review: good place, one can see almost entire area and valley. crowded in summer. can be reached by ropeway also.clouds are around

title: view point of Mussorrie
review: Its a small hillock at about height of 400 meters from Mall road. The place was used by Britishers as a watch point and guns were used to be fire at fix times so that have a idea of time in those days. A road link this point from the Mall road. Some time back a lift service has been introduced and now most of the tourists use this lift to reach there.

title: Gun hill
review: There is nothing much to write home about the ropeway ride. But once you reach the top,you get stunning vista all around. It is a vigorous climb up from near the mall road for those who can. I liked it better than the ropeway.

title: Decent viewpoint - accessible by ropeway
review: The viewpoint is a decent one. Lots of shops where you can relax, eat or use Bioculars/Telescope to view the points. Even without binocular/telescope, the views are good.

title: For a View
review: you go to the top on the ropeway and all ropeways are same- nothing to elaborate i think. but the view from the top is breath-taking. and that combined with the clouds and mist and cool makes your day.

title: View the Town
review: Just a high place to see the town from the highest point of Mussoorie.

title: Views are all hidden behind shops
review: The administration has to do something, all the commercial establishment leaves no room for any view points or relaxing place.

title: First time cable car riders it's amazing
review: Nice experience. On reaching gunhill point, you will enjoy the sight of everything around you. But this is a small distance ride with good gradient. In g point you will be welcomed with some more photographic experience in local attire.  Air gun shooting, bow and arrow shooting skill experience. Enjoy everything. Don't mind expenses. Try to become happier.  What you spend today can be earned tomorrow.. But live today.  Take your binoculars.

title: A Nothing Attraction!
review: A nothing attraction not offering much in terms of enjoyment except games like shooting or arcade games. Offers a great birds eye view of Mussorie town and Dehradun city. The telescopes around the area will let you view some of the important attractions around the city like a local village, Sachin Tendulkar's house, an old wall which served as a border, etc. The cable car used to reach the attraction is great fun. Sadly the approach on the hill has been turned into a garbage dump by the tourists.

title: Gun Hill, Mussoorie - Not worth it !!
review: Firstly the hill is in a gun's shape but only if you view as bird ;P

title: Good view
review: The best part is the view and cable car ride. The games on top are really dated , gun shoot and ring throwing.

title: Dissapointment
review: One has to go up in a rickety old trolley as they call it and once you reach up there you feel as if you have come to some 1930 or so shabby place. The lovely views which may have been at one stage from this place is all covered up by shacks put by street shops. Can be a lovely place but in a very bad condition and the main thing which is the view is all hidden.

title: Scenic beauty
review: Right on mall road go through ropeway up gives a very good view. If one doesn't want to go to cloudsend could be a lower alternative

title: Nothing special except a good view.
review: Authority needs to give extra emphasis to make this place a great experience as the place is historical. otherwise this place is in a very bad shape. Govt. can hire some good landscaping consultant to give it a new look.

title: Up hill!
review: We took the opening first cable car of the day to gun hill..known for the excellent views on a clear day..The place is a little walk on the mall road..The ropeway takes us to the hill within 2to  3 minutes ..There is a temple at the top along with  rows of food shops to snack. .also there are games to keep the children occupied also a few places which with telescope which show various view around the place. .Over all a nice place to spend 1 2 hours and catch a birds view of mussouri..

title: Himalaya View from the Top of Hill
review: Good Place if you are looking for some peace from the fast and rush of the market. You will get some photography option with local cultural dresses

title: Just for timepass
review: There are two options to reach gun hill. One is through walk and other is rope way. We took rope way. Up and down 100 per person. Only going through rope way is good. Tat too the window is not tat clear to view the scenery. On the top of gun hill it was only small games small shops and small food places

title: Nice view and lots of games
review: Commercialization has covered the beauty of GunHill. As soon you step out from the cable car you are surrounded by numerous stalls. And the shopkeepers will shout and ask you to visit their stall. The view is very good. Kids can enjoy as there is lot of open space and games.

title: Highest point in Mussori
review: It is highest point in Mussori with scenic views from top. You can either walk or reach by rope way. Walking is not preferred for aged people.  Waiting time rope way will be testing your patience.

title: Nice View , but Small station
review: We have reached this Gun Hill by cable car , and there we have seen over all hill of Mussorie , it was good experienced but the station is too small , where you can go for snack and sit for nice view for one hour.

title: Gun Hill is the peak of Mussoorie
review: Attraction in Mussoorie Gun Hill is the peak of Mussoorie. Gun Hill beautiful view of some of the highest Hill ranges. The point also offers a picturesque view of Mussoorie town and Doon Valley. You can enjoy thrilling ropeway ride to land at this beautiful misty peak. The ropeway ride swings between the Hall and Gun Hill, In Mussoorie there is an alternate route but very steep to climb. Good open place for children and family visit.

title: Huge waste of time and money
review: There is absolutely nothing to see from this point. There are hoards of shop keepers selling low quality stuff, and ready to pounce and hassle any tourist who step foot outside the Gondola that takes you up.

title: Nothing great at Gun Hill
review: I visited Gun Hill after waiting for over an hour for the cable car. The place is quite decent and could have been developed well considering so many tourists visit. There is not much activities except few kids games. The quality of food is also average. You can go during evening and relax as this place offers great mountain views.

title: Worst Municipiallity
review: I have sen worst municipality and administration in mussorrie who is having no control on vendors they have spoiled such nice tourist place it is second highest point of mussoorie to see the glimpses of Complete mussoorie but due to all round shops you cannot have view in any side.I Pray to District Administration to divide the part to loclas and as well as for the tourists from govt is taking different type of taxes

title: Gunhill
review: Complete waste of time. Just exorbitantly charging restaurants and games there. Not worth the money the take for the ropeway.

title: Top of Mussoorie
review: You are really missing lot if you are not listing this place as part of your trip. One side while you can see Mussoorie and Doon valley, then other side Himalayan range has stunning view.

title: Good view
review: Nice view of the valley with some good activities around. One can easily spend 1-2 hours. However, it gets chilly in evening so carry warm clothes.

title: Amazing Sunset view
review: This place is extremely well-placed for Sunset. You get a very good view of the peaks and some places through Binocular. The around looks like a festive area. You take a Cable Car to reach the place. You can spend more time to enjoy the view of valley & sunset. Would recommend a must visit place.

title: Not worth going at all.
review: Climbed around 2km of the steep climbing visited in March all shops were closed as March is not for tourist to visit. Only go if have time.

title: View of the himalayas
review: The top affords view of the himalayas on one hand and Dehradun valley on another. The cable car ride is fun. Enjoy a cuppa at the top and there are some places for food and handicrafts.

title: Got Excited By The Hype & Left Disappointed
review: This is just your average on top of a hill point. Nothing great specially in non-winter season. Unnecessary stalls and shops, completely devastated the beauty it could have been. Nothing to offer, stay away as far as possible.

title: average food
review: if you want location please visit this foos restaurant.but food is average and service alsove not near to very good they are doing good but lots of improvements required.because you cant survive with view only.best time to go there in afternoon.

title: Nice place
review: Good for one time visit. Views are good. Shops and small eateries line up the whole place. Kids will like the experience.

title: Nothing much to offer
review: Doesnt have any great view which you cant get from any of the decent hotel itself. shopkeepers keep on pestering you. only good thing is kids can enjoy as there is lot of open space due to lack of crowd

title: Good view & place to do time pass!
review: Gun Hill point gives you a great view of Mussoorie. My friends and I choose to walk our way up and had a lot of fun and got some great pictures.

title: Good View !
review: The beauty of GunHill has been lost with all the commercialization. As soon you step out from the cable car you are surrounded by numerous stalls and shops with all shopkeepers shouting and pursing you to go to their stall/shop.

title: This place is reachable
review: Its a sunset point, reachable by ropeway, you will find activities like hoopla stall, shooting etc. Shopping options are also available, Shani Temple is also there on hill.

title: Terrific walk - the rope way was under maintenance
review: I am not sure if I would have gone up if the ropeway was functional. The climb was the best part of the trip. Steep. Heart thumping. The view from the top is sensational

title: All the views are blocked by stalls
review: It's nothing g more than a market with food stalls, games, and filth all over the place. Sad. Very sad. Could have been such a wonderful place.

title: BORE AND DULL
review: A place to be missed for sure. Go for the trolley ride and come back. Nothing to see or do there. Very sad place to be. The cable car is old and in a bad shape with torn seats and scratched glass.

title: A good trolley experience.
review: To reach this point either you should cover the distance walking or by trolley. We took the latter and it was a good experience. At gun hill there was some renovation going on. It was bit chilling there. You can play some games and have some food. It's a good experience.

title: Just like any other place
review: Like any other place with ropeway. Places to eat, play games, shop, nice view... and come back down.

title: The top is a fairground!
review: My wife and I wanted to take in the view at the top - unfortunately this was spoilt by the many shooting stalls etc that block the view. One has to find gaps between the stalls to discover the view - pity!

title: Lost its original charm
review: Gun Hill lost its original charm of giving the mountain range view. All three view directions has been blocked by vendors for games and food stalls and giving just one attraction which is the cable car ride and the wait and cost is not worth it. I remember when we were kids and visited the place we could see the Himalayan ranges and snow clad mountains. Used to sit there eat pakkodas and tea watch the sunset now there is no viewing point left. The Gun Hill has lost its charm

title: Terrible
review: You can reach the gunhill point after taking the cable car from the mall road , jhoola ghar. The view is good from the top but it is all surrounded by small shops selling food and wares. This spoils the beauty of the place.

title: Good view
review: Good view of overall mussorie. Nice weather to be enjoyed with friends.

title: You May visit Gun Hill!!
review: Five minute cable car ride from mall road. This place is nothing much but average.Overcrowded with commercial activities( Shops & eat stalls) . Only way to reach this place is by cable car. You have to wait in long que to get into cable car. You can enjoy mountain views nothing else. So you may think  before visiting this place.

title: touristy hill top
review: take the rope way up to this hill top overlooking the doon valley on one side and the himalayas on the other. The view are very nice but rest of it is very touristy with small shops for snacks and photographers hounding you to take photos in local costumes. Small shacks for kid games and rifle shooting. Do it if you are in mussoorie to tick it off the list for ever.

title: Good views but not worth the steep climb!
review: Great views from up there but it is a very steep climb to the top. Would I highly recommend it - no! If you are rather adventurous,  go for it. You just have a couple of commercials stalls up there and am sure you could spend that 40 mins on something better on Mall Road

title: Nothing much
review: It is a 5 minute cable car ride from mall road. The view from top is good but too much commercialism has spoiled the charm of this place. There are too many shops and eating joints here which are not required since everything is available below on mall road.

title: Good view of Himalayan range
review: This is a historical & nostalgic place for many. A good view point. Beautiful location for spending some leisure time. Kids and youngs like the spot for the Telescope for viewing Himalayan ranges & valley. Missouri town view from top is also enjoyable. For youngs walking steep road to the top is an adventure but for seniors it is too much to walk up about  25 minutes.

title: Gun hill
review: what a crazy place for the activities. its too amazing and u can do here most of the activities and can enjoy

title: Pls avoid, its a dead spot now
review: A trolley takes you to gunhill for 100 rs. The ride lasts less than a minute but there could be waiting. Once you reach the top you come across shops that have now been permanently closed, a few stalls with balloons to aim at and others trying to get you in a Pahari outfit for a photo. The views are not that great either. Food is available from small tea shops. We found it difficult to spend half an hour there as the spot is now a shadow of what it was.

title: Nice, but not particularly special
review: Took a cab up to Gun Hill.  A small charge was required to go up the building to the top to use a rather poor telescope.  Coffee without sugar wasn't available.

title: Spend some good time enjoying climate and if you lucky find the upper himalayas
review: nothing much to see as such but being at top of a hill is cool.. if the visibility is good then you can see yamunotri range from there..

title: very boring kids might like it somewhat but not for adults
review: its not worth it if you wish to experience trolley ride might as well do it at kempty falls as it is slightly better then as compared to gun hill . trolleys are old, dirty and poorly maintained. there is nothing to see at the top of gun hill apart from view which is beautiful but that you can see from most places in mussoorie. my advice don't waste your time on this

title: Too commercialised.
review: Took the rope way up. Not of good quality as the windows are broken and frosted so do not offer any views.

title: Very nice view but nothing to do other than
review: Approach to this location is by cable car, charging ₹75 per person for return. U can catch cable car from Mall Road. Once u reach at the point few restaurants and play shops are there, nothing else. U will get a nice view of Himalayas, that's it. Worth for one time watch.

title: Just a little elevated point with small sundry shops
review: When the weather is clear, you can get a glimpse of snow clad himalayas, apart from that this place is expensive for all those little sundry items and food items that are sold there. The "Uran-Khatola" ride also is over rated. If you have less time in Mussoorie then might as well skip it, walk to Lal Tibba instead.

title: Top view of mussorie extreme cold place
review: Such a great view of mussorie its one of the view point in mussorie

title: Okay okay place
review: The Place is okay okay. Don't expect much as except some good mountain views nothing is more interesting. To reach this place we have to use cable car from mall road. Cable car management is pathetic and they only want to make profit irrespective passenger safety. some shops is on gun hill same as on mall road and other area of Mussorie. Go only when you have some extra time.

title: Just for the aerial cable way ride!!
review: At INR 100 per head it is quite okay for people who don't have vertigo!

title: Destroyed nature and fully commercialized view
review: This is probably the best place to watch sunset, enjoy some quite time and spend time in nature. But it becomes pathetic because of commercialization.

title: Experience cable car
review: Used cable car to reach at the point. ~Rs.100 per person from mall road to gun hill and come back. Good view of musooorrie while going up from cable car. At point ... one can click photos in traditional costumes; games for kids; and some scenic views.

title: Good view but only commercial place and shops...thats it
review: To reach the place you need to take cable car which you will enjoy the small ride. As you reach there the place will give you excellent view of Mussoorie with clouds near you, but you will feel bit disappointed as there is nothing as much there except shops shops and shops.

title: Nice place
review: It's a nice place where you can get anything. It's a shopper's paradise as the place is overcrowded with shops. One can reach the place only by cable cars. Must visit the place if you are in Musoorie.

title: Avaerage place
review: This place is average.To reach this place we have to use cable car & one can enjoy mountain views.Place is highly commercialized with shops all around

title: Nothing to Visit
review: this place was a hell. it is a hill top on you have to go through cable car from mall road. There is nothing,only so many shops to  cut your wallet.the view is almost blocked by the shops and IT IS NOT THE HIGHEST HILLTOP OF MUSSOORIE. And if you are with kids ,don`t go there.

title: nice point but poorly maintained
review: its a high point with a good view but has been thoroughly commercialized hence the real beauty covered by shops .

title: Lovely views, Annoying touts
review: This place is accessible by cable car. Offers some great views of the Yamunotri and Gangotri (or so I was told). It's a great place to hang out and take in the sublime views of the mountains. But shopkeepers pestering you to buy stuff from their shops can be annoying sometimes.

title: Ok types...
review: Actual place to visit is  d mall... kempty falls where kids can enjoy... Here kids didn't enjoy much.... but one tym go is ok...

title: Good
review: it is the hill top of mussoorie.....it has great view and you will see the huge range of mountains with snow capped from that hill

title: overrated- but fun
review: fun to go up the cable car. shanty stalls ruin the hill top. typical govt negligence.. there are tea stalls etc and a guty with telescope who point out the views to you. including the ghost town of landour

title: New year visit
review: The gun point is a place from where the valley view and the city view is excellent

title: Could have been better managed
review: Could have been better managed

title: Shops and Shops and Shops....
review: Shops and Shops and Shops....and nothing else there to see,if only weather is nice then you can see the HIMALAYAS from one end,to get to this place you can walk here and also by cable car.

title: Must to go
review: Its a must to visit the place, as you need to take the cable car to reach the place but its surely a must to view the entire valley with great natures gift.

title: good but bad place
review: to go to the gun hill you have to wait for some 2-3 hours to get the ticket. and after that you have to sit very tightly in your trolly. this is like commercialization of a simple place.

title: Avoid
review: There are better places to get the view. The shops and photographer are eye sore and pesky photographers are irritant. Even driving towards Kempty fall give better view

title: Nice view of Himalayas
review: The right place to enjoy the sunset in Himalayas and experience Mussoorie at night. The ropeway needs to be changed its outdated and risky.

title: lost its charm......better to avoid
review: This Place has completely lost its charm. it was known for its view but now after taking the trolley you will just see only few shops nothing more than that. Trolley service also needs to be improved a lot.

title: Highest point of Mussoorie
review: Gunhill is the highest point of Mussoorie from where one can enjoy the panoramic view of the Doon valley. However there are too many shops on top which have ruined the view. One can hardly find a spot to admire the Doon valley.

title: Good
review: Gunhill visit is good & enjoyable especially the ropeway ride otherwise nothing specialu can see that

title: Disappointed-only attraction could be ropeway
review: Once you reach there you will feel highly disappointed. Highly commercialized place and the activities which they offer could be easily found in local 'Mela'

title: top of the hill
review: reaching gun hill is a bit exciting as one needs to go up in the ropeway. the two way journey costs Rs. 75 and one must come from mall to ropeway in cycle rickshaw at 25INR per seat.

title: extra time???? kill here
review: To me, Gun Hill is a forced attraction of Mussoorie... nothing great... since there is a ropeway, it is in the list of attractions....whatever view Gun Hill offers is subdued by the presence of large commercial establishments... too many vendors who bug you incessantly and spoil your joyous mood. There is a rope way which connects Mall Road to top of Gun Hill and there is a walk way too ... one should take 10-15 mins to reach the top.

title: Perfect
review: Entire family had fun, there is a trolley ride, they charge 75 rs for to and fro per person. Gun hill is basically a water tank built by British. I think it is still used in town

title: The usual "mela ground" feel!
review: The place is doted with kiosks and there are a few street food joints and now they have come up with a temple too, accessing by rope-way makes it a attractive to kids!

title: Overrated
review: Overrated place. I visited this place in the early 90s, things haven't changed much. Since it is in the heart of the town,  tourist do flock this spot,  but don't expect much.  One time visit.

title: Visit for the View of Himalayas + Some Fun time
review: Nice place to visit for Kids ..Rope way from Mall road takes to Gun Hill for 75 Rs Per Person ( to and fro

title: Try the old ropeway
review: I don;t think the ropeway has ever broken, but it is pretty old. One can climb up to the top of Gun Hill, using a path up past the Kacheri courts, but you might rather walk back down as it is a good climb. At the top there are so many little shops and stalls that you need to work to find a view of the town and snow mountains. Magic tricks, toys, broken down rides for kids, Garwhali dress-ups, etc...  The top of Gun Hill stores the water for Mussoorie in huge tanks pumped up from Jinsy, Bhilaru, etc.

title: Good sight seeing spot
review: We reached Gun Hill on mid-day but due to intense cold and the sky being obscured, it was bitingly chilled and the wind lashed at us, so could not stay up for much time. There was no Sun and hence we were frozen almost. The food and coffee offered by the local vendors gave us some warmth.

title: Commercialized
review: Gun Hill is accessible by a cable car from Mall road. The place had a good potential as it provided nice views of the doon valley..but sadly its almost destroyed by the over commercialization of petty shops which diminish the charm of this place.

title: Nothing great
review: Easiest way to reach is via the rope way. The place is nothing great. Has shops selling food and circus games.

title: Nonsense
review: Why people crowd this is because there's a ropeway from Mall road to this point. Once at the peak there are some stupid game stalls for kids. No great view.

title: Nothing worth Seeing!!
review: To reach this place one needs to take a rope way from jhoolaghar which costs Rs. 75/person for the trip.When you reach gun hill there is nothing more than a few games for kids. The food is not really good over there.

title: Not a place worth visiting
review: The place is located atop a hill but apart from 2 small balconies you cannot see anything from there. This is because the place is so commercialised that one feels like why the hell have we come here. There is nothing notable about it. Can be skipped.

title: Amazing view....
review: Amazing.....

title: The shopkeepers are just here to loot you
review: The rate of playing games is more than the probability of winning them. Here only a keyring or something like that shop gives you good gift items at a fair price,rest everything is nearly junk.

title: An Amazing View !
review: This is pleasant 20 minute walk by a bridal path that forks off from Mall Road. A rope way ride is also available to this second highest peak of Mussoorie but distance of rope way is only 400 Meters. Gun hill offers a beautiful panoramic view of the Himalayan ranges namely Bunderpunch, Shrikanta, Pithwara & Gangotri group and bird's eye view of Mussoorie  town & Doon valley.

title: Best part of Mussorie, Must visit Place
review: The best place in Mussorie, but Temprature is quite down than mussorie. You can reach at this place by Cable Car. Lots of fun activities was there. Food was also great. The best part is the view of Mountains covered full of snow.

title: Nice View
review: If you are interested in seeing the entire hill view of mussories, this is a place to be in, otherwise there is nothing much to be admired upon, just a few shops.

title: Nice Hill with great view of Mussoorie.
review: Nice Hill with great view of Mussoorie. you may walk about 1.2 Km on mall road from Library chock to reach gun hill bottom.

title: Snow view
review: Gun hill can be reached by the ropeway and those who are afraid of the ropeway  (cable car) can hire a taxi.

title: It Is Just A Hill But Can Enjoy Great Views Of Mussoorie
review: This is a hill and there is nothing much to do here apart from the magnificent views of Mussoorie.

title: Just for the sake of it
review: The ride through rope way is the only good thing. Other than that on a windy and cold evening a plate of maggi and a cup of tea will be memorable. Otherwise the very purpose o this point i.e to view Mussoorie through a designated point is not worth it. Every corner is occupied by shops. Shooting games (for children mainly) can be bargained.

title: Avoid if you can
review: Nothin worth doing at gunhill.  Sub standard food and long queues awaits you if u plan to waste 3 hours of yr trip.

title: An avoidable place
review: If you want to experience rope way or cable car then it is ok to go there, other wise it is totally wastage of money and time.

title: Good View Point
review: One needs to take the Cable Car on Mall Road to get there.  Rickshaws cannot take you there because the road is very, very steep. Walking is very difficult for those not used to climbing up steep slopes. The Cable Car is the best option for tourists (Rs 75 per head).  Try to go there in the morning hours to get a good view of the valley and mountain ranges.

title: Good for an evening out
review: This is a view point which people generally visit for the charm of a ropeway ride from mall road. It is also accessible by steps. There is a parmament fair and food stalls at the top. In clear season you will get to see some Himalayn peaks. Nothing great, but you may visit it in the afternoon if you get bored with Mall road.

title: Beautiful Location, no food, no activity.
review: Reachable by trolley as well as by stairs (some 300). You have options of tea and snacks and no further. Majestic views of snow peaks from this place.

title: One of the Good Spot for Traveller
review: To reach this spot you have two options one by Ropeway which is little  pricey and little scary too after looking at the trolley you feel that needs a good renovation and maintenance, they ask to sit more than ten but it hardly takes 8 passenger easily or you feel suffocated .other way to reach is by road/stairs and track which we didn't use therefore I don't know about it.

title: for a birds eye view of dehradun oneside and gangotri the other
review: gun hill is just a cable car ride away from the mall road.

title: Avoid.. same views.. highy comercialised.
review: Its a prime example of what marketing can do for a place. Gun Hill is nothing but a flat hill top that is supposed to provide 360 degrees view of the surrounding hills and valleys. Problem is, so many eateries have come up on that tiny stretch of flat land that you won't be able to view anything. To get the views you have to make your way in between two shops and reach a open space from where you will be able to see the same mountains and valleys you could see from the mall road itself. And the side that's not visible from the Mall road, you can see that once you visit Kempty Falls.

title: Viewpoint
review: Gunhill offers entire view of hills surrounding mussorie, reachable by cable cars and   has some food outlets where some time  can be spent. Avoidable, if having less time.

title: Gun Hill @ cool place to visit
review: The most famous and loved tourist attraction as Mussoorie. Its one of the highest peak and its give picturesque view of Mussoorie town. Tee place is accessible thought roap way.

title: Average
review: It has an average view...if you wanna experience ropeway then go for it...othereise it was an ok ok place

title: Funny Ropeway
review: As everybody said earlier, dont waste time here. The ropeway can offer good valley views. It wont move till its filled and they compress us. 75 bucks per person for to and fro. This ropeway has clear  instruction on one of the signboard saying 'If there is a power cut or technical glitch while ropewaying, you wont be given back any money'. Seriously? For godsake atleast let us know how will we reach then! Want us to get stuck for life, hanging literally? May be they meant ' Jump ! Break your head, do whatever, if this ropeway gets shut somewhere. We got the Money already!

title: A neat place to visit
review: We reached Gun Hill by the gondola and were pleasantly surprised to see the  coffee and craft shops. They also had a mini amusement park  for the kids to enjoy.  The area provides a good view of the beautiful mountains, valleys and houses perched on ledges along the steep slopes.

title: Disappointed
review: There is not much to see over here. The place is full of stalls like balloon shooting, food stalls, Photo studios to take pictures in traditional dresses etc. However you can feel touching the clouds here. Not a must visit place.

title: Must visit place
review: You can reach Gun hill by Cable Car or there is a way also. But cable car option is good one. This is must visit place in Mussorie, Atmosphere of Gun Hill is totally diffrent from Mussorie. One can see beautiful mountains from here.

title: Great Place to get amazing views of the hills
review: A beautiful point to get the best of the views Mussoorie has to offer. You can take a cable car or walk up directly if you want. The restaurant at the back side of the place provides the best views of the hills. Another must visit place in Mussoorie

title: How to kill the golden goose
review: The only reason to visit Gun Hill is the views of Himalayan peaks and surroundings but there are so many shops mushroomed around that only a small uncomfortable space left for viewing.

title: Go there for cable car experience. Too commercialized blocking views!
review: This place you can reach easily from Mall road and a cable car takes you to the top of the hill for Rs.80 (return journey). But it is all FULL of shops leaving a very little or no space for views. All cheap stuff to entertain kids. Only breather is the good ginger tea you get where the telescope is placed (It is in a small corner, you can easily miss it). Not worth it. Better give it a miss.

title: Wasteful hill
review: Its not a hill point in fact people have made it a gaming zone.  U can just find small food stalls, games like 7 up 7 down, balloon shooting, ring games here. No nature beauty , hardly any place to see the view ...

title: Good location
review: This is a run down point accessible by the ropeway and the road. As soon as you get off the rope way, you are approached by all the shopkeepers and restaurant owners to patronise their business. The view is completely blocked by these establishments.

title: Not So Great
review: This is one of the few things to do in mussoorie when on mall road...the only good thing is the ropeway ride..the views are not much different from mall road..

title: Nothing Much To See
review: Mussoorie  is my favorite destination and if you ask me about gun hill it can be good for first time visitors but for me there is nothing to see,you have to stand up in long queues for tickets and trolley on both sides while going up and coming down.

title: wasteful expenditire
review: Pathetic ropeway for 80 bucks! Reach on top and shoot baloons with the gun (air gun) that's why the name gun hill. Lol!

title: Offers a nice view
review: We went here by trolley and were the first to reach there. No shops had opened at 10 am, which was good for us in a way.

title: Average table top
review: This is place to visit maybe for 30-40 min where kids can enjoy some games. Although quality of toys and games are not great but nevertheless some time pass

title: This place deserves better
review: This place could be so much better with efforts from all the authorities. It's very disappointing in its current state.

title: skip this as cable car is there in Kempty Falls also and games are at mall road too.
review: One have to avail cable car to reach to that place and that's the only attraction for this place. On top there is a market which have shops for Games like archery, Shooting balloons. There are photographers who would click the pick in some local dress. You can skip this as cable car is there in Kempty Falls also and games are at mall road too.

title: Ropeway ride of Mussourie
review: Walking on the Mall Road you can reach this destination where by paying a paltry INR 80.00 you get to ride a rope-way atop the gun hill which will put all the other rope-ways in the world to shame. It is too old though safe and takes you atop the hill where you come across lot of funny little game zones and few eateries. If you can ignore all this materialistic stuff, and try to enjoy the view it's an amazing experience. You can see practically all of Mussourie and surrounding hills and valleys. It’s said that you can view the Kanchenjunga from here if the skies are clear unfortunately when we went there last month it was clouded and we loved every bit of time spent there sipping hot cup of tea and gorging on noodles.

title: Nice view of mussorie and mountains
review: Good experience of cable car if you haven't taken a ride. At the top the view is nice, air is cooler than the town. Very good view of valley and on a clear day you can also see snow covered peaks. There are a few game options that kids can enjoy like shooting ballons, archery etc... Few stalls selling low quality magic games and gifts. There are food stalls for snacks you can sit click photos of the nice valley view from the top, nice time pass for a couple of hours.

title: Time pass
review: The only thing enjoyable I feel, was the trolley/ropeway ride up and down.

title: Limited view, too much commercialized but cool place
review: Due to height, air is cold and has nice feel. Too much commercialized and has limited view. Cable car to the place is old but still a nice experience.

title: GUN Hill
review: We went there using Cable car.Very nice view from the top. Have lots of small shops and eateries.Good place for time pass.

title: view of musoorie
review: You have to reach here by ropeway for viewing the whole musoorie from this place .you will feel cold wave here which will cool your heart and body

title: Still the jewel of Mussoorie
review: The ropeway is old, the carriage cabin glasses have turned brown, seats are worn out, the hill top has turned into is a big eatery & recreation joint, it's crowded....but somewhere still it's an attraction. If you can ignore all the above, and stand at the highest point (where very few people go) near the deserted building, it's an amazing view of Mussoorie and surrounding hills and valleys. The sunset from there was breath taking. The profiles of Blue mountains at the horizon reminds you of the pages from Rushkin Bond's books.

title: more for kids and first timers
review: More hype than substance, if you don't want to hike the treacherous path then take the cable car with a return fare,

title: Very beautiful place if the weather is clear
review: Again its a very beautiful place if the weather is clear. If clouds are around you can't see the majestic view of Musoorie. Entry fee for Cable-car is INR.75/- for both side.

title: View is just ordinary ... must visit only for Ropeway
review: Ropeway ride is ok... it takes around 4-5 min in one way... in total 8-10 min... view from the top is same what you could see from anywhere else... it has a sani bhagwan temple at the top and durga mata mandir... should visit once.

title: So SO
review: it was ok, there was nothing much to see or do up there. But the view was amazing, while coming down had to wait in the queue for 30 minutes,

title: Not too great!
review: Waste of time. Nothing great, its surrounded by shops/hawkers all round, who keep pestering you for everything. No natural view as its over crowded by the shops.

title: Don't chose this hotel for your stay
review: One word for this hotel is Pathetic.

title: Mela on hill top
review: Went up using the trolley. It was good fun. The wait was long, but experience enjoyable. But I remember there was a time when it was not full of stalls, and open viewing place, that was better experience.

title: good for a view
review: though nothing as what it used to be earlier

title: Relaxing experience
review: Nice place to go and relax for a while. One can visit this place taking a junk cable car ride (very badly maintained and shame on those operating it).

title: Place to see himalayas range
review: To view himalayas and mussoorie top view..can visit this place. Here you can also enjoy some games and food. Things are in budget and it is near to Mall road. You can reach here by trolley and can even trek to this place.

title: Nice views. Nice cable car ride. Tacky amusements.
review: This is something that everyone has to do when visiting Mussoori. It's a nice ride up to the top of the central hill in town. But the games and rides at the top of the cable car lift are less than thrilling. The ancient temples on top are significant for devout Hindus.

title: Should avoid..its highly crowded with hawkers
review: Apart from the ropeway to reach the topmost point in mussorie, there is anything at gunhill. Its full of small shops and hawkers who will force you to their shops. No view is available due to shops all around. Better to skip this location and spend more time at camel back road.

title: Rope way
review: Good attraction for small adventure on rope way. Scenic view from the top is excellent. Small shopping shops for mementos and temple are good time killers

title: Good place to visit
review: Its the second highest point in Mussoorie and there is one cable car that take you up, you can also go by foot if you want its just 500mtrs from down but at a steep height. At top its beautiful, clouds are everywhere and you can enjoy the beauty of nature sitting for an hour or 2. There are a couples of shops for eating, playing and buying a few stuff.

title: Sarkari CT
review: Let's say that if you get thrills out of going up a Cable Car @ ₹75/- a piece....beating the climb to a small terrace hill top where you would be pestered by small time cheats pulling you to take air gun shots at balloons in a gamble which is tipped ...and eating Maggie noodle substitutes with extremely sweet chai with some corn cobs roasted on charcoal ...you must go up the Gun Hill ...not much else ...even the view is not much too see on account of fog..the place is ofcourse as clean and crowded as rest of Swach Bharat.

title: A place over hyped
review: we went on to go for GUN Hill view but was a bit let down because of not so well maintained cable car and commercialised top view.
