Quite similar to the name there were some games to play including one of Gun shooting. Not so much impressed personally but while being there if nothing better to do then you can make a visit

title: FUN AND PHOTOGRAPHY
review: Good view and a unique experience of trolley carrying so many with ease and lot of fun activity plus wonderful place for photoghraphy

title: Jeet liya dil, Gunhill.....
review: After walking 30-35 minutes through MALL ROAD when you tiredly reach at Gunhill, you must feel very relaxed. You will find the Golden Dehradun City at Sunset time from the Gunhill.

title: The Journey is Better then the destination!
review: As i titled the review the journey to this point is much better then the actual location. Took a sky rail to the top the view of the valley and the Mussorie town is breath taking. It is hardly 2 mins on this ride and another 2 mins down but this is the best part of this entire journey. The top point is not really that nice has mediocre joints and not much to do. Moreover it was raining so it was all water logged and nothing much to do around. But yet an attraction to see and be for once provided  you have patience to stand and wait for more then an hour

title: great experience!
review: Took a sky rail to the top of gun hill.  Great view from the top of the mountain.  Good venders selling souvenirs and tea.

title: good
review: good time pass. enjoyable rope way ride. nothing special but still good enough for one visit.

title: Must See place... Honeymooners paradise
review: It is one of the Must See place... It's situated on the highest peak of Mussoorie.  Honeymooners paradise, every one should enjoy togetherness there... Enjoy Ropeway ride....

title: Ropeway is good. Shops are same as mall roads. Good view.
review: Visited there in September.  View is really good from there, but as is from any good place in mussorie.  Shops are all same as you will find on Mall road. Ropeway was the best part about it.

title: No No Nopes!!
review: The whole gun hill is covered by shop keepers who want u to play archery/ shoot the pellet gun on some balloons/learn magic tricks. there are absolutely no scenic beauty left on gun hill. whatever is left has been covered up by the shop keepers and the dhabawalas. Avoid it and better roam on mall road.

title: Must Visit Location
review: Nice location and view ... should visit the place , if you have child they can enjoy the games their

title: Avoid
review: Waste of time going to this attraction. The shops/vendors have all setup shops killing the views.

title: Top Attraction of Mussoorie
review: Apart from the mall road the gun hill is a must see. get up to the hill via ropeway. there are lots things to do for kids also. enjoy the views from the top to the valley below.

title: could be better
review: A pleasant short cable car ride gets you up to the top but there you will only find a paved ground full of tourist stalls, telescopes, photographers etc.

title: good
review: this is the place where you can see a very beautiful view. this was worth watching. this is very close to picture palace.

title: The beauty
review: The most famous attraction in Mussoorie and the Second highest point of Mussoorie..this is the place where you can see amazing view.

title: Need to pay attention  by Uttrakhand Govt.
review: its average experience at gun hill it can be better if Uttrakhand Govt do some development at this place

title: Felling can't expleane
review: you will se himalaya from gun hill, very special felling can't enplane, if you stay at mussoorie you have to stay as near as mall road, hotel mall palace is best option night life zyada nahi hai so hotel jitni jaldi wapas aay utna acha hai view hotel se hi mil jayga aapko

title: Nice place ti visit above the city
review: It is a nice place to visit above the city...also had some traditional shops..in nature and clouds..

title: See Dehradun
review: It's the top most point of Mussoorie. U can see whole Dehradun valley, rivers, their valleys, mountains. It is beautiful to see down n around from there.

title: From here you can see the Mountain covered with snow.
review: The view from the gun hill is breathtaking and you can view mountains covered with snow and here your children can enjoy various games.

title: No gun but still Gun hill
review: India >> Uttarakhand >> Mussoorie >> Attractions >> Gun Hill

title: kids had fun
review: Gun Hill is situated on mall road and is the second highest  tourist spot after lal dibba ..... you can enjoy the scenic view of himalayan ranges from one side and the whole panoramic of city from the other side .. 3-4 hrs are sufficient

title: was good in clouds
review: went there in monsoon. have the clouds all over the place. Loved spending time over there. Many joints are there which serve tea, maggi (oops other noodles now), pakoras, parathas etc which was way too yummy in that weather. Many games for kids are also available

title: Good Place on the Top
review: Gun Hill is on top of a hill which can be reached by a rope-way from the Mall Road. We had to wait for long for taking the rope-way to reach the point. You will get a nice view of Mussoorie and surrounded hills from this spot. Unfortunately the place is captured by too many vendors for selling products you won't get the feelings of enjoying the nature.

title: Not that exiting
review: learned a lot from others, was very exited to find the place. Quite far from where we stayed. The ropeway trip is very short but good, the place could be better if not commercialized.

title: 2nd Heighest Peak of musoorie, A view of himalayas
review: Visiting musoorie , gun hill made me amaze , saw himalayas aftger long time, had some gaming up here, Good place , must to be visited

title: Wish it had no 'development'
review: Walking up the hill rather than taking he rope way is a great way of working out. However despite the clear views all around the presence of so many outlets selling food, souvenirs etc take away a lot from the pristine place it should have been. It seems an extension of the mall road with crowds coming up on the rope way for tea and pakoras while posing in local outfits.

title: offers vally view
review: Highest point in Mussorie. but lots of shops and market cover the surroundings. Hawkers nuisance etc.

title: Over rated
review: Could have avoided it.nothing special up there. Food pathetic and taste terrible. Better to carry from mall road.

title: Awsome view
review: Must visit place if you visit mussoorie you get a nice view of the valley mountains trees clouds beautiful scenic beauty

title: Great view of the the surrounding hills.
review: Above the clouds experience. Great view. Easy access by the rope trolley. Sit back and enjoy the scenery.

title: Must Visit For A Cup of Coffee
review: To get there you can take the trolley, there is also a way to get there  from the backside but most tourists don't know about it. The view from up there is breathtaking.

title: Absolutely nothing to write home about
review: No views just shops and shops. They have not even left any space to view the valley. Absolute waste of time and money. Had to wait for 75 mins for the ropeway and they charge Rs 75 per person. Time and money not well spent.

title: Highest point in Mussorie
review: Its feels like u r on top of everything and everyone. The point is the highest u can go. You can feel the clouds around you. It just gives u an awesome feeling.

title: Only Hype
review: I went there second time after few years and found that too many shops has left no value in this spot. I know everyone wants to get there but its pure hype now. if you are taking a walk on mall road/Camel back road then you wont see much difference.  try to get your ticket number as early as possible and even if you miss this point don't feel bad.

title: nothing worth seeing
review: The place does not have much to offer.Just random shops which teach magic and few shooting games.The eatries are also not so good.

title: trollet ride was good
review: we enjoyed the ride on the trollet, place has good view. It started raining when we reached so could not take much pictures

title: Must place to visit
review: Must place to visit when ever You are in Mussoorie. Great view of valley while travelling in trolley. Proximity to nature. A place to enjoy weather God.

title: Visit for the fun of walking, nothing more!
review: We took the ropeway to Gun Hill. First - the bogeys of the ropeway were dirty and stinking. Second - Gun Hill is over-commercialized now. There are too many shops blocking all the views. You feel like being in some cheap market. The walk down to Mall Road is nice (we did not take the ropeway for return, and rightfully so).

title: Beautiful View!
review: You can reach Gun Hill through Ropeway Cart. But Ropeway is a pain. You have  to buy ticket in advance. It takes a lot of time to reach gun hill. But it is only a 15mins place. There is nothing to see except the view where you can see whole Mussoorie and Dehradhun.

title: Highest attraction in Mussouri
review: From Mall Road,one  may take ropeway trolley to reach this biggest,highest attraction .If sky is clearl ,one may see valley views from different angles and sides.Food stalls and shops are useless.Place reqires proper makeup and cleaning regularly..

title: Ok ok sorta place
review: Nice place to have tea or coffee sitting on the edge provided by some retaurant owners. One can walk or book a troley for which we waited for 2hrs. but were awe struck for the wait felt worthless reaching the top. Commercialized at the top, every shop owner would compel to come and play at their shop some games and all. Shani devta temple is also here which is good to have seen.

title: Nothing much to do
review: The only reason one comes here is because of the ropeway. Else there is no other reason to come to this plateau. It had nothing exciting about the place with free eating options which seemed unhygienic to me.

title: Nice view
review: We reached Gun Hill using rope way. We had to wait for 4 hours to get our turn for rope way ride. Advance booking of ticket is advised. Once at the top we got excellent view of hills and valley. Locals informed that snow caped mountains are also visible on clear days. However presence of shops all around makes it difficult to get clear and broad view. At the same time we got our pictures taken by local photographer in local costumes and enjoyed the weather there.

title: Nothing interesting
review: Rope way trolley has no appropriate safety measures & charges are over-priced. Even at Gun-hill point safety measures are not taken. Not safe for kids.

title: Average
review: There is nothing extraordinary at this place but if you are in Mussoorie just go here for fun and to enjoy a trolly ride. There are few eating joints, games counters , photographers , temple and  view of hills.

title: Absolute waste of time
review: Its a waste of time to stand in a long que for hours for a cable car. It is better to spend the time in hotel. There is nothing much to do in Gunhill.

title: Okay Kinda
review: Good but not that delightful. Also depends on which season you go there. Good when in monsoon or winters.

title: Not that good
review: Only thing i liked was clicking few pics from Gun point. Place was same as downhill Mall market. Thing to enjoy was Ropeway from Mall road to gun hill & back to Mall road. Food joints were not good. One time visit is ok. Nothing much their uphill.

title: superb view fron Gun hill
review: Awsum weather here,Sit on telescopic point.very awsum view and tea and pakodas of that shop are really good.

title: Cant see any Hill!!!
review: Only thrill is the travel on the cable car... make sure you come by 9 am and book the car or the lines builds up... Nothing much on the hill as it surrounded by tin sheets and shops which keeps coming at you to play games and eat... Avoid it or just go for the cable thrills for kids.

title: average spot
review: you would only find game shops and tea/coffe spots

title: NO GUNS - NO VIEW
review: Supposed to be beautiful views.. but nothing on top except stalls, more stalls and yet more stalls. Better go on Camel Back road, you get more scenic beauty there and can see Gun Hill from far - which is how you should keep it.  My kids called it Gunda Hill ..

title: Second Highest Point
review: Not very interesting to climb but the only thing is to enjoy the rope way.

title: One of the popular things
review: There appears to be a standard waiting period of 2 hours or so. The ropeway takes you upthere nothing much to do after some photographs you tend to get bore. And you get in the line for coming back. We can say much hoopla about nothing except good photos.

title: ropeway is beautiful
review: the view of whole of the mussoorie is just awesome..and even the sight of rocky mountains... u wish it goes on and on

title: Total waste of time , Just like a diwali mela, nothing else
review: Liked:

title: one hill to another
review: ropewy is so awesome and beautiful .. takes u from one hill to another... gunhill offers various things .. from food to games... views are stunning too

title: Nice Hike up
review: You can take the rope way, but we hike up this place to get a nice view of the city and the mountains around.

title: Book trolley ticket in advance
review: Liked :The trolley ride, View from Gun hill, local games at the hill top

title: Nice
review: It was a great spot to enjoy the time. Had a Great time as they have numerous game and restaurant with best services and people around. Also beautiful view from the top of the hill.

title: Great place spoiled by a commercialization misadventure
review: The place is inherently awesome with breathtaking view of mussoorie valley. But the commercialization bid of local administration very effectively spoils the basic goodness of the place. The fleecing/pestering stall owners are very discouraging and ensures tourist to dare visit the place once only. Most of the Stalls in general offer same kind of stuff than their counterparts.

title: If you low trekking, do not miss gun hill
review: Gun hill is the place where i stayed while on tour to Mussorie. This place offers a great view of Mussorie city. You can enjoy trekking from Mall road till up the highest point. There is a rope way as well to take tourist from Mall road to highest point. I did not go for the same as trekking was more enjoyable for me rather than ride on ropeway

title: Big NO NO
review: If the Ropeway is working then its fine to travel there other wise don't trip to waste your time in climbing the mountain to go to gun hill. Its a big plan surface on the top of the mussoorie from where the king used to aim his enemies by his big cannons...

title: Great scenic view
review: We spent a couple of hours at the Gun hill a couple of days back.

title: Good view
review: Take the ropeway to gun hill from mall road. This place is the top-most point of mussoorie from where you can a birds eye view of mussoorie and the doon valley. People come here to click pictures. You can get a very nice sunset shot.

title: Nice Trek
review: The trek is nice even though the actual place is highly commercialized. I would suggest doing the trek rather than taking the rope way. The trek starts next to hotel Tulip Inn and will take about 20-25 mins. It is a steep trek, do it only if you are fit.

title: Great views but nothing else
review: Unlike many other points in Mussoorie, this point also offers a 360 degree of the mountains around Mussoorie. The sunset from here is mesmerizing. However, I did not like the fact that most of the area is blocked by the vendors.

title: Okay experience
review: The main attraction of the Gun Hill is the ropeway that takes you to the top.  The place itself is not very attractive and provide a decent view of the mountains.   There are several eating joints and photographers eager to click your photos in fancy dresses.

title: Old world charm, but very touristy
review: Not entirely to my taste yet it may revive your childhood memories if you have been to mussoorie in your childhood and seen it when it was greener and had cooler weather.

title: Was pleasant even in the rains.
review: We visited Gun Hill in the morning in February. As soon as we sat in the trolley, it started raining. I enjoyed the ride as we gained heights and the view became gander. Very few tourists were there on the hilltop and we felt like celebrities as we were crowded by the shop owners. The views from the hill are wonderful. Highly recommended during any season.

title: what a view
review: You will have a splendid view from this place of the mussorie range.  Your trip there includes going by the cable car, which is also exciting. A spot not to miss...

title: Cable car, views on top, Parvati goddess temple.
review: Short Cable car ride, views from the top, Parvati goddess temple, general shooting games etc. gift article shops.....

title: A great lookout point at the top of a ropeway
review: The water tanks on top of Gun Hill are mainly covered with little shops catering to the local tourists. On a clear day the views are superb - down to the Dun valley as well as the snowy Himalaya. It is easy to walk back down to The Mall.

title: Waste of time
review: absolute waste of time. the beast part was going uphill on the ropeway and the ropeway also was rickety.

title: Superb View
review: Awesome view, Feels like you are in heavens..

title: lovely place to enjoy views
review: I used to go up there every day as it is just above my hotel Avalon resort. Gun point is the highest place. I would go straight to Telescopic point and enjoy my tea with pakoras and maggy with stunning views of Dehradun valley and Lal Tiba.

title: Its at a height and thats about all there is to it
review: Too much of the touristy stuff and theres barely a quiet corner to get away from it at all. Prices are highly inflated. While Mussorie itself has become extremely crowded these days Gun Hill is at the centre of whats going wrong with the place.

title: Not worth
review: Waste of time standing in a long queue for one hour to take the cable car up to Gun Hill and find it totally commercialised out there. There is not even a decent view from up there.

title: Not such a great place
review: - Gun hill is situated at mall road and is the second highest point after Laal Tibba in Mussoorie. There is a rope-way service to and from mall road to this place. Enthusiasts can even opt to walk. The waiting time for the rope-way is more than expected in peak hours.

title: Cable Car ride to the top..too commercialized..no spectacular views
review: Another place in Mussoorie where you expect something different, but get only a commercialized view point..

title: The Gun Hill was disappointing - even the gun of history was nonexistent!
review: The cable car up and down was about the only interesting point of the trip here. The shops and litter ruin both place and view.

title: Worth only if you go by walking
review: Brilliant view if u go by trekking which is 500mtrs uphill. the Gun Hill TOP do not have much other then food places and playing zones.

title: Absolute waste of a good tourist spot
review: The only highlight of visiting gun hill is the rope way ride which i am sure the authorities could have maintained in a better manner.

title: Must visit
review: A ropeway ride at Rs. 60 can take you to the Gun Hill or you can take a bridle path that deviates from the Mall. You can capturevery beautiful photogenic views from this place. You may be lucky of you get chance to see snow-filled Himalayas.

title: Natural beauty crowded by commercial people
review: I was not able to find out a small place where I can sit alone and take the enjoy of natural beauty. Total area is occupied with shops and every moment they will in around you to sell their stuff. Really a nice place but fully occupied by shops and they will snatch your purpose for which you went there.

title: Avoid at all cost
review: the place is not worth your time & money. there are better places than Gun Hill in Mussoorie. Only if you want a Joyride in the Rs 75 per head cable car (trolley), u should go to gun hill. Some of the highlights of the place are:

title: Fun at Gun Hill
review: Very scenic. Shanidev Temple with attractive and pleasant Idol. So many hang out spots to enjoy. If lucky you can see the snow peaks from here. Very near and walkable from Club Mahindra Resort. For us it was nice and the best tracking path. We enjoyed.

title: On the top
review: Hello, this is the 2nd highest peak after Lal Tibba in Mussoorie. One can reach the top only in Ropeway cable car from Mall Road. You can see the entire town of Mussoorie. Don't miss.

title: on  Top In The Mountain
review: It is situated in the Hughes Point In Mussorie Its Good For a Picnic With Family The Ropewsy Ride To  Gun Hill Is Excellent Its Good  For Pucnic And For Praising Beauty Of Nature Situated on Top Of The Mountain

title: Nice one
review: You can see all the mussoorie views while going up hill.  I had lunch on the top of the hill ,but quality of food is pathetic  . I suggest you must go at least one time......

title: Nothing, except the rope way!
review: Really useless place to visit unless you want to travel in the ropeway which is decent. Otherwise, the hill itself has nothing to offer except lots of commercial establishments atop, who just hound u like anything once u reach there ! Much better places for view points in Mussoorie.

title: An overhyped place
review: An overhyped place only because of the height it is at. Rest everything up there is is lousy and not worth it. Ok for one time visit. Be ready to get in long ques to travel on top through a cable car.

title: fun place
review: you will have to take a cable car to get there. once you are on top, a typical indian fare kind of atmosphere is there. it called gun hill cos of a gun placed there during british rule for time mapping.

title: A VIEW CURTAILED
review: Gun Hill is one of the 'musts' for any tourist in Mussorie. The Rope Way is a big attraction for people of all ages. The views from the top of the hill are indeed Panoramic. Other than the views, there is nothing much for a serious traveller; but plenty of 'light fun' awaits a tourist

title: Gun Hill - must go
review: The best part of Gun Hill is the roap way ride  Though it is only 5 min but worth it.  On top you have a nice view and pleasent weather particularly if you go eraly morning / late afternoon

title: Devoid of any scenic beauty
review: Gun Hill is the top end of the ropeway . One can also walk all the way up. The entire area is now blocked with shops , and one hardly gets  a glimpse of scenic beauty one would expect from such a high point. commercialisation has taken its toll and it was a big let down from what it was 25 years ago. The ropeway ride lasts for approx 10-15 minutes , so if that is your agenda , go for it.....

title: Only for Rope way.
review: This place is only for those intersted in ropeway otherwise nothing much to offer. View of the mountains from ropeway is breathtaking. One of the famous tourist attractions here.

title: Extremely commercial
review: a Ropeway from mall road takes you there. Food items are not allowed (but sold at the counter where tickets are there), after you  buy the food items you will ahve to consume all before boarding the ropeway.

title: A disappointment !
review: After walking up a very steep hill hoping we would arrive at an area where you would have a viewing area of the snow capped Himalayas we were disappointed to be in a rather run down delapidated stall area with lots of tired looking magic stalls and very unappealing old looking toys. No area to really have a look at the view at all. It is also the top of the cable way which is old and rickety!

title: must visit place
review: you haven't seen mussourie until you visit gunhill...it gives you a beautiful scenic view of the great himalyas when the sky is clear.and also you can sharpen your shooting and archery skills...

title: Nice View with Nice Location.
review: Gun Hill is the Heart of Mussoorie. whenever go to Mussoorie Gun Hill was our first destination. The View from the Gun Hill was superb. Even u can spend whole day with so many activity like games, delicious foods, Drinks etc. The Ropeway when you move from the Mall was superb. I have visited mussoorie more then 10 times but my last visit with my friends was so good due to i found first time snow at mussorrie. All Vally was covered with white cotton and view from Gun Hill was amazing.

title: Touch the clouds if you can : )
review: the ride is through a cable car..

title: not so good
review: This place is accessible by Rope Way and stairs as well but on this place you do not found more place to view downward or sight seeing. this place totally covered by shops and some dangerous places or edges are left for view. When you reach there all shopkeepers want to catch you to take theirs stuff which they are selling and they disturb you every time But on the other hand the AAloo Chat on the top is best thing.

title: Gun Hill Mussourie
review: Enjoy rope way ride while going to Gun Hill. There are view points. Telescope. Enjoy food in the restaurants. Good time pass for kids.

title: On the top of mussorie
review: You can take to and fro cable car for this hill. The view from this place is decent. But this is among few things to do while in mussoorie.

title: Nothing much to do
review: In my opinion there is nothing much to do at Gunhill point exept a nice ride on Cable car. The views are similar to that of Mall road and nearby. There are no. of tea and snacks and kids play Shops. Quite dirty and disorganised.

title: Highly commercialized
review: Unlike most travellers, we decided to walk up to Gun hill. There are some great views while going up hill. The climb is a little steep and I would not recommend it for people who are not used to walking/trekking. The top of Gun Hill was disappointing - the place was heavily commercialized. Just find a quiet corner over here, sit down, relax and have ginger tea and Maggi.

title: NICE VIEW
review: amazing view you can see himalaya mountains from here with 360 degree view of valley. take

title: Must Avoid Place!!!!!
review: Not a good place to visit. If you are tracking or taking Rope way, in both ways it is a waste of money. I would suggest while going Mussoorie avoid Gun Hill Point for sure. Only one exception is children, i dont know but they can have some fun...as there are small shops which offers games...ring...archer aim...etc

title: My favorite place
review: Its my favorite place in mussorie coz it gives you an all round view. Momos at the restaurant just next to the walkway up are a must have.

title: A hike to remember
review: Instead of taking a rope-way ride, we hiked up to this place call Gun Hill. The rope-way ride can be taken from the center of mall road. But if you prefer to hike to this place, near the famous aquarium spot you will find a path leading to Gun Hill. It took us approximately 30 minutes to reach the top. The Club Mahindra resort is located mid-way to the hill. The hill is quaint and you will find many shops offering shooting and some more games.

title: Beautiful sceneries and ambience
review: we haD a nice experience going up the hill with cable car. Being up there was a good experience. The beautiful sceneries of mussorie were just superb. People were nice and kind.

title: top of mussourie
review: This hill is significant of mussourie..we went there expecting to have a nice ride to the top of the hill but unfortunately the cable car taking us up was closed for repairs..gives a spectacular 360 degrees view of mussourie..

title: super view and amazing
review: super sunset view after a ride in the cable car. A good place for kids to run around. nice view of hills and visit afternoon and evenining time..

title: amazing view and great location for picture clicks
review: get in there though roap way and you can have as much clicks as possible. The view of mountain valley is awesome.

title: Gun HILL
review: there is a cable car which takes you to the top of Gun hill. One can get good view from top.But the shops located in the vicinity just spoil the view. Not worth visiting.

title: A Nice Peak
review: Gun Hill is leading attraction of Mussoorie amongst tourist. Gun Hill is second highest Peak of Mussoorie. We can reach top of Gun Hill by a cable car. The rope way is of in 400 metres in length. We enjoyed fully here. Some of heighest himalayan ranges and Arieal View is of Mussoorie re main attraction of Gun Hill.

title: only for view
review: i think that going up the rope way is pretty nice and bit adventurous trip.. but i will only recommend people who want a view of the valley .. should only go

title: Vie to Remember
review: This point has a history and a view to marvel. Sit in one of the stalls sipping ginger tea and soaking in the stunning views of the landscape below. Entire Dehradun can be seen from Gun Point.

title: A wonderful view of the hills
review: The Gun Hill is approachable by a walking track from the Mall Road as well as the rope way. There is a Mela like atmosphere on the top. We tried our hands at archery, air gun shooting and the ring your gift among other games. The children loved it most. Although you can spend just about half hour to 45 minutes on top, the view from the Gunn Hill is beautiful and a must do.

title: Good View of Himalayas
review: One can get a very good view of snow covered Himalayas from Gun Hill. You can go walking to Gun Hill or through the Rope Car / Trolley. This trolley would be more than 30 years old and it is great fun to reach Gun Hill through it rather than walking. You can get some good eating joints at Gun Hill and spend 1-2 hours easily.

title: Beautiful
review: There are very small things that make the whole 'Gun Hill' experience memorable. It begins with the short rope-way, then the small shops on top, to the breath-taking beauty of the view from that height, to a plate of masala maggi and hot chai. All these things together make Gun Hill special.

title: Total waste of time.
review: Total waste of time, unless you have kids who want to try cable car(to reach the top) and play(Balloon Shooting, Ring throwing etc) among multiple stall set up.

title: Gun Hill
review: Nice View of dehradun fro this point. Cable car is available to go this point.Clean place. Since it was not a peak time when we visited hence we were able to spend more time over there.

title: Must visit place of mussoorie
review: Gun hill is located in centre of mussoorie u can have good view of footsteps of the himalaya from here many paid binoculars are available there which will show you the pauri and garwhal region also stall for games are there for kids to enjoy and the main attraction of the place is its ropeway

title: Cable Trolley ride to Gun Hill
review: Every 5 minutes there is a cable trolley for both going up and down Gun Hill. We got very spectacular views from it. Very sturdy, safe, silent and comfortable seating arrangement in its cabin. . They load 12 pax per trip.

title: the home for local photographers
review: this place  has awesome view of the entire garhwal Himalayas during the clear days in mussoorie this place so many tourist visits every season and takes a photos wearing a local dress and other Indian wears

title: Nothing much
review: This was our second visit, after 25 years. At that time, the place was bustling with activity, but now it was almost deserted, probably because this was off-season. There is a new Shani temple. Only photographers promising pictures in 10 minutes. There was a group of school children climbing up to the hill, which is next to the Club Mahindra resort, from which we got a head start and did not have much climbing to do. The ropeway was under repair. On the whole, disappointing.

title: a tourist attraction
review: if you wish to take a ropeway ride, do visit the gun hill, another popular tourist attraction. always take a two way ropeway ticket it is cheaper.

title: Good view
review: Nice sunset view after a ride in the cable car.  Not much else up there.  A good place for kids to run around.

title: Can get some view of Himalayas
review: If you are here in Mussorie then this place is must... take a 3-3 minutes cable ride from  Mall road to the top of hill from where you can see whole Mussorie, Dehradhun town and other small villages. Up there they have a paid telescopic views which shows your view of the places Kedarnath mountain , Gharwal village etc....

title: Nice place for Kids
review: Clean Surroundings and great weather makes this place Good for Kid's Entertainment and Enjoyment.....Loved the Golgappas's and Local food very much

title: Nice view of peak of Himalya
review: One will definitely enjoy the ropeway trolly travelling & Nice view of Himalya's peak. But  food shops  at GUNHILL are really bad ,please avoid to have food there.............

title: Gun Hill
review: This hill is supposed to be a viewing point but when we went there we found that the whole area is covered with shops which block the view. A very narrow ledge was available for viewing the Himalyan range but the place was very dirty and stinking.

title: Go there for the views
review: Perhaps the 2nd highest altitude point in Mussourie, it offers fantastic panoramic views of the beautiful valley and the majestic mountain ranges. The paid telescopes provide awesome views of the glaciers Gangotri, Yamnotri and Kedarnath along with many other popular spots around the town.

title: SUnset Lovers dont miss it
review: The view is brilliant. Dont miss the Sunset. And the small stall cafe at the end of the edge have a sip coffee whicle facing the most amazing mountains

title: Nice View point
review: Nice view point.. you will be able to see whole mussoorie. The paid telescopes provide awesome views of the glaciers Gangotri, Yamnotri and Kedarnath along with many other popular spots around the town.

title: Mediocre!
review: Go there for the views! Nothing much to see or do up there! Little shops serving quick bites and coffee. Do not use the trolley - or rather, use it one way. Choose to walk back down - the landscapes are beautiful!

title: full view of dehradun from this place
review: The place is approachable from the mall road. No vehicles are allowed. One has to walk up the hill, about 500 meters from the Mall. Rope-rail facility is available. One gets excellent view of snow-clad mountains, The Himalayas. There are good observation points. A temple of Shani Dev is close by. Binoculars , if you carry, you get good views of nearby valleys and mountains.

title: Cable Car Experience
review: At the end of Mall road there is a cable car station.You can reach the Gun Hill thro' cable car.They give you a two way ticket.Gun hill is a view point.But unfortunately whole view is completely blocked by Shops. In between the lanes of shops at few places you see valley view.Except for the cable car experience it is very disappointing.The Local bodies can limit the shops and arrange a safe view points.

title: Gun Hill, Mussoorie
review: Never miss this point.  At the top you have many activities for kids.  We encountered hail storm here and it was an experience of life time.

title: not worth it but enjoyed the trek up the hill
review: disappointing.  I wish they had maintained the historical sanctity of the place.  You just find rows of hawkers selling chips and silly games.  Spoils the view.

title: The best Rope way Ride to Gun Hill
review: One of the most excellent experiences ever had was going to Gun Hill by Rope Way, the Bird Eye view of Mussorie was really overwhelming showcasing the complete beauty of Mussorie

title: a good place to kill time
review: one has to take the cable car to reach the top. After reaching at the top you realize it quite commercialized with every one asking you to play games like shooting, archery and other stuff.

title: Super touristy
review: I was a bit scared about maintenance of the cable car.Average conditions of the cable car, glass was dirty from outside so views were a bit blurred and they loaded many people ( some were standing ) both ways.Nothing at the top. View point also not made properly , broken steps lead to a not so safe view point. Could give it a miss!

title: No place for view
review: This is supposed to be a view point wherein one can watch snow-clad mountains and breath taking view of Himalayas. Problem is that, there is no space left for the same. Only shops are there to watch. Ropeway is thrilling.

title: Very poor
review: The only good thing about this was taking a ride on the ropeway to the Gun Hill. Other than that, it is a terrible place. Even the Gun used is not there on exhibition

title: Only cable car show
review: There is nothing except Cable car riding. Cable car must require maintenance as glass was broken. you won't find any gun at gun hill.There is nothing except few shops. but cable car is thrilling experience.

title: Waste of time and money
review: Nothing special at this place, spent Rs. 150 for couple for Ropeway to this place and on reaching the top found only shops and shops. total waste of time and money.

title: Awsome
review: Itz a very good place we can see Himalayas everything and whole mussorie from der enjoyed the shooting der and cafe from which we can see gangotri that's awsome

title: one of the places to go
review: It's a hill top in the center of Mussoorie which one can reach on foot (takes about 30 to 60 minutes according to fitness level) or by the cable card/ trolley on Mall Road. Originally, people come here for the view (which is available from between the many shops and stalls). The entire platform is arranged to accommodate and entertain hundreds. Usually the paranthas are very good. The rest rooms are not very clean. All in all, a visit to Mussoorie is incomplete without having been to this place.

title: Awesome Views
review: It was a great sunny day when we went to Gun Hill.. The ride was for five minutes by the cable car.. have had better at nainital and gulmarg phase II..The view from the top is really amazing... it was sunny but the wind was still chilling.. we stayed for 3 hours and enjoyed a lot,, played all games possible,, from archery, ball throw, rings, number slot , shooting,.. everything possible.. won a few as well.. Overall it was a great experience..

title: Only For Ropeway....
review: There is not much when you go up, just a few shops and eating stalls etc,just attrection only rope way...other wise no thing i seeing there....

title: Nice
review: You need to take cable car to reach the place....it is one of the highest point to see mountain view and sunset....let of small shop setup on top for tea and snacks.....

title: Dont know why they call it Gunhill.
review: The rope way ride is ok. When you get there, there are few restaurants, very small though. Not much to do.

title: Average
review: a total waste of time..if u have short stay in Mussoorie..it took almost 2 hours for our turn to get into the Trolly..trolly ride experience is good but that too is for a very short duration(2-3 mins)...

title: A Good View On Top
review: Gun Hill is good to spend a few hours in mussoorie . Ropeway ticket costs rs.75 . Ropeway was good. But we have to stand in a lond queue waiting for our turn. Gun hill has many restaurants and shops. And the view is also awesome.

title: It has become a market
review: They have turned Gun Hill to a market. Now the open views and air is not there. Yes there are lots of games to be played. I feel if they could have kept at least 50% of the view open it would have been great.

title: Nice Sun Set
review: one need to take rope way from Mall road to reach Gun Hill,

title: Disappointing
review: Totally commercialised, Gun Hill has nothing to offer. They have made a shani mandir now which will no doubt, become a revered tourist attraction in years to come.

title: average
review: the place is sure not worth the wait of an hour or more to get your turn in the rope way, and once you reach, to your dismal you find only shops, shops and shops like chawpati. hardly find way to sneak thru the view point, which are anyway one has seen through if you are going a day later. skip safely if you are hard pressed for time

title: Spend some extra time here
review: Gun Hill located at 6800 feet above sea level.This is second highest point of Mussoorrie after Lal Tibba (8000 feet). Cable car rope way station is in middle of Mall Road. It takes about 5 minutes to reach on the top from where a good view of Himalayan ranges is seen. View of Mussoorie town  can also be enjoyed. You can also choose to go to Gun Hill on foot, if you have time and like trekking.

title: nothing special..
review: Good location but shop keepers have covered from all direction hence no view from Gun Hill. Feel time waste on Gun Hill

title: Nostalgia!
review: I was coming back to Mussoorie after about 20 years and I had the first deja vu moment when I reached Gun Hill. It is quite fun to reach Gun Hill via the ropeway. Once at Gun Hill wear the traditional clothes and get yourself clicked. If you happen to be a photography enthusiast, you have the chance of getting some really good shots of Mussoorie from the Gun Hill.

title: Great walk
review: There is a cable car that goes to the top.  Best way to go is on foot.  Takes about 20 to 30 minutes to get to top.  Excellent views

title: Gun Hill
review: My mum and uncle remember the original [real] cannon, I was impressed - as always - by the kites [birds] soaring above and recognising ?pumpkins? growing wild, a bit like Helen Cresswell's The Bongleweed

title: BEAUTIFUL
review: Its a very good place to visit and it can be reached upon by either a ropeway which takes around 6-7 minutes and other being tracking which can take around 30-40 minutes.

title: Poorly Managed Place
review: I did not find anything interesting in this place other than just a visit as you have come to mussoorie & also to sit in cable car.Personally I did not like any place worth eating over there.We just played games & came down.

title: nice view of valley
review: I visited in Oct'14 with family.

title: Superb view but highly commercialized
review: When you reach gunhill via the ropeway, be prepared, all your expectations of a breathtaking view will be shattered. The entire hilltop is covered with shops encircling you and you have only a single food joint with 10-15 chairs facing the valley and snow-clad peaks. However, there is a telescope point which can accomodate 7-10 people and from where you can see the valley and snow-clad peaks.

title: Lovely view of the city
review: The top most view of the city. Can be accessed through a walk from the mall road (this walk will test the last ounce of your stamina since it is very steep and will take 20 min of heartbeating effort) or through a ropeway from the mall road (further ahead of the walking entrance). on the top, there are many shops to eat,play and shop(key chain, trinklets- nothing major). there are two three view points, two odd temple. best is to go there before the sun set to catch the city in daylight and night light.

title: Scienic views, good walk , if you can
review: As we stayed close to this place we walk through to the Gun Hill. What a beautiful views on the way. But on top things aren't so rosy, lots and lots of shops with very little space left to see the views all around, but still it worth visiting this place. Rope way is certainly added charm for kids. But climbing up on foot is a great experience. Tip - one can come back by cable car .

title: Time Pass !!!
review: This place is just a time pass. You have to take a cable car to go at the top. Very poorly maintained car. The windows are so dirty that you can't see anything while going up and down. Management should look into this way. Once you are at top there are few games stall and food stalls to pass your time. The only good thing is that you can have a good view for your eyes over there.

title: Good view
review: The view is excellent. Nothing more to do. Enjoy with a glass of hot coffee and click as much photos you want.hahhaa..

title: Just go there for the cable car ride
review: I'm not sure if the views from this point would fall under the "breathtaking" category. Its worth a visit only if you want to experience the cable car ride. Which again comes with a long waiting time.

title: i was staying on Gun hill
review: brilliant view of valley  ( i have attache one view) I was claiming from my resort to top of the Gun hill. you can also take rope way  from Mall road. return journey will cost you Rs.75

title: Kids enjoyed alot
review: The cable car ride was exciting for the children. You get an excellent view of the valley from Gun Hill. There is nothing much to do except play a few games, relax and enjoy the coffee/tea and take lots of pictures. There are also photo shops which have the facility of you dressing up like hill tribe people and they take your photographs. The children enjoyed that a lot. Great place to spend a few spare hours if you have time on your hand.

title: PLACES OF CROOKS
review: The name suggests -gun hill,sounds exotic.

title: Great view, too many salesmen
review: Gun Hill is on top of a hill which is reached by a ropeway from the Mall Road.

title: valley view's
review: This place is at very high point from the main market area, here you can go up the hill by rope way, or if you are fit enough and like to track you can walk up the difficult way, on top of the hill its table land where there are many shops for snacks and here you can rent different types of cloths for photography but you need to bargain to get best price

title: Over hyped place having no good view from top
review: Surely a hyped place. Have to wait for several hours for cable car. On the top if anyone expecting of getting a nice view they will regret afterwards. Overall the place looks like having a village fair with some cheap type of games & shops selling costly items. This place is a visit only for cable ride experience.

title: Do visit place at least once
review: To enjoy the ride on the cab car and reaching on top of the hill is very nice experience. small market with comparitively higher priced items available on the top. small restaurants offer good food. two side of the hill offer completely different view. one side is gun hill view point and other is view of snow covered mountains kedarnath and badrinath as told by the photographers.

title: All hype
review: Touristy stuff like dress-up and get photographed; the one good viewpoint was actually a paid eating joint.

title: not for a cloudy day
review: Second highest point of Mussoorie, easily accessible from Mall Road by rope way or walking trail. on a sunny day one can get a view of snow capped peaks of Himalays, but in cloudy weather like when we visited nothing is visible and it's diappointing.

title: Must Place to visit
review: Must place to visit when you are in Mussoorie. Access to this place is from mid of Mall road. The place offers a spell-bounding views of Himalayas.

title: You won't miss much if you don't visit this place
review: As this was the closest sightseeing point from our hotel, we went there just to have a good morning walk in the hill. Didn't have idea how steep was the road, anyway it was a different type of experience. There is a temple in the top of the hill and you can enjoy the view from the top.

title: cable cabin to gun hill
review: omg its been 30 yrs since i have been going there but gun hill is still the same, still same old cable cars going up or down, with some breath taking views & once up there same old but beautiful things , i mean get dressed kasmire style to take picture etc, you can actually see  Himalayas covered with snow from there. have chai & pakora's & then play some games & come down , but the truth is I even now each time go and do the same thing again. A must visit

title: worth the climb
review: After the climb from the mall we were lucky when arriving at the top of gun hill as we could see the mountains (which is rare during the monsoon). The top of the hill is a sort of Luna park with attractions mainly for kids, and it is nice to see them playing.

title: able cabin to gun hill
review: omg its been 10 yrs since i have been going there but gun hill is still the same, still same old cable cars going up or down, with some breath taking views & once up there same old but beautiful things , i mean get dressed kasmire style to take picture etc, you can actually see Himalayas covered with snow from there. have chai & pakora's & then play some games & come down , but the truth is I even now each time go and do the same thing again. A must visit

title: a nice place to have ahot cup of tea
review: its height is amazing and you will find lot of handicraft shops at the top. the view of the snow clad Himalaya peaks is awesome

title: Ok Place
review: This is a ok place to visit,Not much to do there only you will lose money in the games there.In july fog was heavy so could not see the view of himalayas.

title: Go for the View
review: You reach a height from where you can enjoy good views. also there is a temple to offer prayers. Good place to go for a change.

title: Terrible!!
review: Don't waste money and time to go there. The cable car ride is pathetic. No views grin the top. Will be Constantly bugged by photographers.

title: One time visit
review: Good views if the sky is clear, 1-2 hours can be spend along with kids as they have made it a games hub, not modern games though. Cable car is ok and you cant expect such a thrilling ride but its fine for one time in 75 rs per person.

title: No more Gun Hill view left
review: the location once a hot fav amongst tourists, is now a waste of time. Only solace is the cable car ride to Gun Hill point nd back, although you could walk up as well. The embarkment land is filled with all sorts of stores. The main point from where u get the majestic views,is closed due to security reasons nd life risk.

title: The View is Astounding
review: Loved: the incredible view, the soaring Himalayas on one side and the Doon Valley on the other. The "Panoramic Point" had hot tea. The wind froze us so bring your coats and blankets. The air was cool and crisp. The ride up and down in the old cable car is a boon.

title: On Top Of Mussorie
review: You can reach here from Mall Road. as this is situated at top of hill. Weather is continuously changing. There are photographers who take photos from your camera at Rs 5/- per photo and Rs 150/- for the big photo. Enjoy the food, spend time with your beloved at this point.There is rope-way facility available to reach here from Mall road.

title: need to improve
review: need to improve on cleanliness, cable service is also not very clean, poor bathroom, people smoking in line for cable and no one to check

title: Quite a hike up - great view when you get there
review: Might have taken the gondola up and walked down rather than the reverse...had I known about the gondola.

title: Hyped Place
review: Like at most tourist places, this place was again publicized much. On the first day of long weekend, when we reached there, there was waiting for 3.5 hours for the cable car, the next day again it was a big queue and after a wait for an hour we could get it.

title: Why people go there
review: The only reason to go to this point is roapway ride to the top for kids. On top there is nothing but shops selling everything and food joints. One has  couple of opening to view surroundings.

title: All U need to Know
review: Located near the Uttarakhand tourism office.

title: Wastage of time
review: A total wastage of time..the only reason people are getting crazy to go there because of ropeway car experience. .at top you will find only and only shops on all sides,  the experience was not good and we had wasted almost 2 hours in que to reach there and for coming down we prefer padesterian path and it took not more than Ten minutes :)

title: interest of olden days..
review: Seem to be place of interest of olden days when hardly any rope ways were there.Height attained is also not so great. Further after getting there you dont have anything to do except some local games for children ...common everywhere in mussoorie.BUT ticket is not very high as in Timbertrail chandigarh

title: Enjoy ropeway view
review: Nice tourist attraction. View is good from trolley. Ticket per head is 80 bucks to & fro Gun hill point. At Gun hill point, there are small shops offering games for kids

title: Gambler's point..
review: Why I am calling it a gambler's point because there were many stalls who were offering to play shooting/ring/ball hitting etc. This place is on mall road and above 500 meters actually. We enjoyed this place too but there is nothing better than artifical zoo which was most loved by my baby

title: Nice place for children and having a nice view
review: You go on the gun hill through a trolley so that is the first good part. Kids enjoy the ride. It is a small ride or 2 minutes on the top of the hill. There are lot of game parlour old style with games like shooting, archery, ball games, ring games, You can get your children photgraphed in traditional dresses and also eat a nice maggi in any of the small resturants. You get a 360 view of the hills

title: Worth the view
review: Located at mere 15 minutes from the mall road, Gun Hill is worth visiting for its scenic view. The place hosts a variety of dhabas and kids' games. Try and visit in late afternoon.

title: Fully commercialized
review: Its a fully commercialized place.

title: What is it
review: Why Gun Hill?????? What is Gun Hill for?????? Just you go on top through a rope way and there you have several games and food shops and then you come back. The rope way ride is also not worth it. TERRIBLE.

title: bad attraction point
review: they are two ways of going, one is through cable trolley, and other is walking track, i would prefer you go walking if you can, it is breath taking but good, how ever one reaching the top u will fill disappointed as the shop has blocked the view of mountains

title: Fun
review: Little cable car on Mall takes you to Gun Hill.

title: view point
review: the best way to go upto gun hill by cable car from mall road..it hardly takes 5 mins to reach...one there are 2-3 location from where one can have a look at mountains..nice view..a must visit place...the only problem regarding this point is, there are many shops and food joints there..because of that the perfect views are get blocked..but one can manage to see the views by going behind the hotels and shops..

title: Point to have nice view of Himalayas and rope way ride
review: This is a pretty good place on the mall road of mussoorie and needs to be reached via rope way which costs around Rs 75 per person. Point can be reached via walk also but I guess, most tourists will find that too exhaustive. Gun Hill Point in itself is pretty good but as pointed out by another reviewer, there are shops all around & those shops block the view. Without the shops, the place could have been a lot better. Also, since this is a photographic place, you will find lots of photographers asking you to get snapped from them and that is a bit irritating.

title: I visited mussoorie last year
review: It was so awsome. The best way to go upto gun hill by cable car from mall road.it hardly takes 5 mins to reach up at the hill. Place is fun as there are a lot of fun activities. You can spend the half day here with good food options available.

title: Ropeway to Games at Gun Hill
review: Well I don't really know how this got its name as Gun hill but unfortunate we can have experience of rope way traveling in Mussoorie only at this place. First impression was that the rope way must be a traveling time of at least 5-10 minutes but it was a sheer disappointment when we discovered it to be less than even 5 minutes ride. They charge Rs 75/head and only good thing is that there is no time limit at the Gun Hill until evening. The location is pretty good but totally infested with shops which ultimately blocks the view to natural landscapes from such an altitude. However, if the sky is clear, very faded outlines of the snow covered Himalayas are visible, which is really worth giving a look. You can also feel the cool breeze in the broad daylight expected to be coming from the Himalayan ranges. There are lots of shops with lots of games like archery, knocking the glass, bursting baloons, try your luck etc. Desirable time worth spending here is 1 hour at max. And beware of the irritating photographers asking every now and then to dress-up in the ethnic attire and get snapped.

title: A little dirty and nothing to do.
review: This is just like the mall road but on top of the hill. Same restaurants and game parlors that keep blocking your way and keep persuading/pressuring you to play or eat. Not much different than a good view.

title: Okay
review: There is not much that you can see from the Gunill point although it happens to be at a high altitude. The only good thing is that you to go there through ropeway.

title: Good Place
review: Gun Hill is a place in Mussori where you have to reach by trolly ride. From the end of the mall road you can get this trolley ride to reach at the Gun hill. It is a peak mountain point from where you can see the Mussorie. Try to visit the place durng the day time as in night the view is not that clear.

title: gun hill not worth going
review: gun hill is second highest point in mussoorie . only shops and shops on all sides. long queue for cable car to take you up there

title: Can be skipped if you have enjoyed a ride in cable car
review: Nothing at the top. Mediocre views at the best. Better go early morning or late evening for sunset. There's hardly any glance of surrounding due to the archery and small Mela shops surrounding the place.

title: Just OK
review: The Ropeway journey is good. But the place at the top of Gunhill is crowded by shops and shanties, hindering the natural view.

title: Gun Hill still needs improvements
review: Being a Doon-ite I've been to Gun Hill n-number of times and it hasn't changed much in the past several years.

title: Avoidable
review: Gun Hill was a disappointment. The Ropeway journey was cramped. Once on top of the plateau we realized that there was just no place from where one could enjoy the view. The whole quadrangle was taken up by shops, game stalls and tea joints.Photographers hounding you for a Garhwali outfit photo becomes a huge nuisance. An avoidable experience.

title: Worthy of a visit but certainly lots of scope for improvement
review: The trolley service though efficient is poorly maintained.  The glass windows were broken or blurry so cant really enjoy the view.  The gun hill area seems unchanged from last 30 years and it would be nice to see better quality activities and restaurants when one gets there.

title: decent place
review: It can be reached by Rope way from Mall Road. It has lots of Play erena with Lots of Games and restaurants. Good view all around and good place for Children

title: Scenic beauty
review: Gun Hill is just above the main Mussoorie mall road & it is the second highest peak of Mussoorie. It offers enchanting view of some of the highest Himalayan ranges. From here you can also view a picturesque view of Mussoorie town and Doon Valley. You can reach here by rope or walking but that is very steep to climb.

title: Cable Car Ride with a nice view
review: Cable Car ride to Gunhill , There is nothing much to spend time on at the top , a few games for kids and a few ok types eateries. You can skip this if there is no kid with you and you don't really love Cable Ride.

title: Excellent views and to enjoy the strong mountain breezes
review: A short ropeway from the Mall Road (Tickets are Rs 75 per person for both ways) takes you 500 feet above the Mall Road to the top of Gun Hill situated at 7000 feet offering you wonderful views of both Dehra Dun to the south and the wonderful peaks of the Garhwal Himalayas to the north.  On a clear day you can see the Gangotri and Yamunotri peaks from this point.  Is a must visit in Mussoorie.  The market like atmosphere at the top is the only negative

title: Shops Block The View
review: Shops line the perimeter of the table top, blocking a lovely panoramic view of the himalayas, and doon valley. Have to peep in between and behind shops to get a glimpse

title: On top of hill of Mall Road
review: This place has now become just a normal fair place. No open space to look around for the Himalayan range.Nothing new about it apart from the  fact you choose the right place to sit and view the valley with tasty and tangy food items.

title: good visiting place once
review: try at least once through trolley if you have been never before on a trolley to get the experience.

title: Good view but nothing much to do up there
review: We went up to the Gunhill through the Ropeway by paying Rs.75/- round trip. Nothing much to do up there except to have some snacks or play some mela type games. View is good and it was very cold on 30-Dec, Temp should have been around 0deg Celsius.

title: Good Fun
review: The ropeway to Gun hill is a good experience, and Gun hill has a lot many faltu time paas games. You would enjoy if in a group.

title: Best part was the ropeway ride
review: Gun Hill offers something for everyone. No matter with whom you travel, this place will not disappoint you. It offers good food in form of chats, tikkis, hot coffee. It has fun games for your kids like swings, archery or shooting. Plus you get good view of laal tibba. you can dress in local attire and get clicked. best part is the ropeway ride which your kids will enjoy for sure.

title: For A Clear View of Mussoorie
review: Gun Hill is a place at the top of a mountain.... to reach here one needs to take a cable car (Jhoola in local language)... this will take you to the top of the Hill from where the entire Mussoorie is clearly visible... One should have this awesome experience also...

title: Up above..
review: .... One can enjoy the top view of Mussoorie from this place...to reach here one needs to take a cable car...this place will not disappoint you.... I enjoyed the wind which feels very cold and refreshing......

title: Good views - Overrated place
review: Apart from the historical significance of this place, there is not much to offer now besides a great view of the himalayan ranges and the valley. The food stalls, shopping area and game stores seem all a farce at the top.

title: Market Area at Gun Hill
review: We took a Rope-way from the Main Mussoorie Market and reached at the Gun Hill. The hill top is small and gives a view of Himalayan Ranges and Dehra Dun City. After having Tea, Maggi and Momos we walked down to our Resort (Avalon - Club Mahindra), 15-20 min walk from the Gun Hill.

title: relaxing ropeway to a 1-2 hours getaway..
review: Gun hill can be reached by a 5 minute ropeway on mall road.. it is a small hill with views on entire musoorie. The round trip costed me 75 rupees... there are a few shops on top of the hill - playing games , and eateries... we went there in afternoon and had a bread pakora and chai while having view of laltibba and snow covered mountains.. perfect for killing couple of hours..

title: Totally Commercialized
review: This place is totally Commercialized . There were photographers chasing you for a scenic photo. There was nothing great to see.

title: Second highest Point in Mussoorie
review: You can reach this point either by cable car or by 20 minute walk from Library end. Second highest point in Mussoorie. A gun erected here during British regime used to be fired at noon. Hence the name. The water tank for the town is located under the hill. Gives an excellent view of the town as well as the Himalyan range.

title: Awsm trip
review: Just amazing place.....but gun point is tottaly surrounded by local bussines shop n vendor. ....best part was cloud were so close to us

title: Back to the Future
review: The cable car ride up the hill was something out of a movie, to be in such a remote place where there are magicians and other vendors trying to sell you their tricks was fascinating, there was an awesome little restaraunt we sat at and had some delicious snacks and tea looking at the misty sunset to the west of the Himalayas

title: Awesome view of Himalayan mountain range consisting of Kedarnath, Yamunotri and Gangotri
review: Awesome view of the valley below and the Himalayan mountain ranges in the far distance. Its the 2nd highest point in Mussoorie

title: view point
review: This point can be reached by a ropeway,by horse or walking . Aview point good for clicking pictures with local dresses aavailable at photo studios at very nominal rates . Also there are many food stalls to choose from a variety of food.

title: Magnificent View Point
review: I am a regular visitor to Mussoorrei since 1970, seen many changes in this site

title: Awesome weather..
review: it's worth a visit.. The day i visited it was full of clouds and we enjoyed every minutes of staying there in btw the clouds with Maggie,...

title: highest Point in Mussorie
review: Gun point is the highest point in mussorie to travel . It can be reached with the ropeway & you can see the peaks of Himalayas.

title: Awesome View Point
review: It is the Highest Point in Mussoorie, it has magnificent view of valleys. But in Peak tourist season there is a waiting time ranging from 30-60 min. so go early. One can sip a coffee and view the valleys and mountain ranges from the windows of restaurants up there.

title: Peace full place
review: Good Place to Go and Check the Himalayan Range. The Market on the hill is good with the games shop. The archery Is very good and the equipment is too good.

title: Ok hill top
review: Not much of good experience probably it has become more commercialized then required. Only the rope way is the exciting part of the whole place.

title: nice half-day trip!!!
review: the best thing is the ropeway trip to gun hill which gives you a nice view of Mussoorie. The entire place was draped in fog and it was quite chilly. do get a game of gun shooting for yourself..

title: Clouds messed it up
review: The rope way taking people up at Gun hill has very dirty cabins, probably has not been cleaned for a while. On the top , the shopkeepers and brokers , spoil the mood. It could be better organized. The place as such is worth visiting.

title: only for one time visitors
review: well readers this place is high above the mall road and the best way to reach their is by the trolley. u can also go by the raod but it is very steep making it difficult to climb. those vivting mussoorie first time this place is must a visit as you can enjoy the lovely view up at the top. also the ride is good. once reached above you have l'll option to eat n some stalls of games n plenty of photographers lined up to click your picture in traditional attire

title: Gun Hill
review: This is an Average place from where you can see the top of the hills , Yamnotri Glacier if the weather is clear. Its a place where you have just shops to eat and nothing great about this place,

title: Beautiful. ..God's gift
review: Beautiful sight....ropeway is gr8..up d hill its really nice n refreshing...there were many clouds when v went der..so cud not enjoy d sight fully...but a nice experience. ..worth visiting. .der is nothing special up der onlyd view is gr8..

title: Okay...
review: Nothing great about this place except for the joy ride of the gondolas which take you up (optional as you can walk also) through the rope ways route. Nice scenic view of Mussoorie as well as Dehradoon valley.

title: Great View!
review: I really hope it was not so much commercialized with so many shops blocking the view!

title: surrounded by shops
review: theres no charm in the place. its all surrounded by shops and hawkers. a small 4 ft open space serves as a viewing gallery. dont waste time.

title: Average place
review: Except for the cable car there is nothing worth the visit. If you have seen other cable cars, this is passable. The only reason to visit the Gun Hill point is to hire the Gharwal dress and have a picture clicked with the hills in the background.

title: Nothing worth the visit
review: The stalls selling china goods have all come up along the border of gunhill. You dont get any good view from any edge , unless you struggle and go in the backyards of these dirty stalls. The stalls have spoiled the place and they should be evicted from Gunhill to maintain the serenity of the place. Only good thing was the cable car ride to gunhill. Highly dissapointing.

title: A date with Cloud
review: Take rope-way to Gun Hill and bang, you land on a height were monsoon clouds welcomes you if you are visiting in the month of June.  If you want, you can trek to Gun Hill.

title: Only for the cable car ride
review: Go early so that you can buy your ticket and get on the cable car early, else you will have to wait a long time.  Once you're at the top, you will wonder why you went there as there is not much to see other than dhabas, game stalls, photograph stalls, etc. The main reason to go for the view seems to be secondary now, you have to go to the edge of the mountain to see the view and it really does not appear safe if you are there with kids.

title: Worth the wait
review: A very old cable car takes you to the top of the mountain (journey is around 5 minutes). But the top is nothing more than what you see on the mall road. Same shops, same stuff. The view from the top is definitely good but that is only if you do not get fog or rain.

title: Cable car ride is good
review: Gun hill we reach via a Cable car which is a good experience crossing the hill rocks. However once we reach Hill top not much to appreciate. Kids get busy with games and nothing more worth. Same shops as on mall road.

title: It is like a shopping mall.
review: Very disappointing. The complete area is surrounded by shops. One has to find place behind these shops to get SOME view of the valey that too only one or two sides. It's pathetic to see how the place has been commercialized. Dont waste your money on the cable car ride unless that is an attraction.

title: awesome place
review: one of the best points in mussoorie.there is a ropeway to the hill top but it is mostly crowded especially in season.so we decided to walk all  the way up. it was a tough climb of 30 min ,steep n patchy road but all our efforts paid off when we reached the top.it was evening ,clouds all around us,beautiful scenery.we avoided the stupid shops of games etc there n enjoy the view.it is a must visit place.

title: Great Views
review: It lets you have great views of the town below. A few shops offering small props  for magic tricks are quite cool! My kid loved learning magic here!

title: Loved the soft trek to Gun hill
review: Gun hill is one of the high points in Mussorie from where you can see the whole city. In the way encountered various species of lovely flowers

title: Gunhill - Nothing Much
review: Nothing much on Gunhill, except for some shops selling the usual potato chips and noodles. The photographers got on our nerves and kept pestering us to have a picture taken.

title: Gun Hill- A disappointment
review: To can get to Gun Hill by taking the rope way from the middle of Mall road. It cost Rs75 per head. Gun is supposed to give you a great view from the highest point in Mussourie. The ride up on the rope is nice, but the Gun Hill, a flat table top hill is surrounded by small eateries  and and other shops which obstruct the view of the valley below. As soon as you get down on Gun Hill you will be approached by vendors trying to sell you food or goods. There is a water tank constructed in 1920 looming over Gun Hill. I could not figure out why the place was called Gun Hill.

title: Good view
review: You have to use the ropeway to get there. However it has very good views and good photography spot as well. Must visit atleast once.

title: Go by climbing and avoid the ropeway
review: Ropeway is for weak. Instead take your own time to climb the hill. It may take an hour or so, but you will enjoy the climb. The path to climb is excellent and built with concrete road. Many people write that there is nothing to see at top ; but the secret is not on the top of hill, but it is in enjoying the walk or climb. SO if you just want to rush by ropeway to the hill and eat there, this place is not for you.

title: easy access from the Mall road
review: This is an easy excursion as the cable car base is right on the mall road.  The ride up affords good views, but at the top - in typical Indian style - the area on top is full of cheap, side-show and tourist type stalls with little respect given to the natural environment or areas for enjoying the view of the surrounding hills.

title: Good Experience
review: Located quite close to mall road. Easy to reach there as you can find many rickshaws who ferry for Rs. 20 per person one way. View from top is good, only for the fact that the view is blocked by commercial activity. Only 1 or 2 spots where you get some view of valley. Commercial activity include gaming for children (Bowling down glass tumblers, throwing rings, balloon shooting) and little bit of shopping and food. Though kids enjoyed these activity, we adults could only enjoy the rope way up and down.

title: Beuatiful View !
review: Amzaing view ... My bad, I was there on a foggy and rainy morning. But, scenery was outright amazing. A must go ... Ofc, because if you are in Mussourie you are there for those out-of-the-world natural sightings. You can see Himalayas too from Oct-Dec, if I remember correctly !

title: Over commercialized place
review: The trip on the cable cars was very dissappointing as people were being crammed in like cattle and some had to even stand in the car with no place to sit.

title: Too commercialized
review: We planned to go to Gun Hill point by Rope Way in the evening.

title: awesome view
review: the gun hill view was awesome i really liked it. the view of the sunset from that level was unforgettable. everything was looking so perfect from there. i loved it.

title: Bird Eye View of Mussoorie
review: Its highest point of Mussoorie from where you can see entire Mussoorie. During British ruling days Britishers used to fire Guns (Cannons) from this point at various interval of day for time check. However there is no Gun now on the point but it became famous based on this activity. If weather is clean you may see Himalayas from this point. normally in summer it is not visible you may find it during november.

title: Useless place!
review: It is a waste of money and time to go to this place. Any scenery that could have been seen from the hill top is blocked by the various stalls that crowds this place. The only place where you could actually see the surrounding is by the toilet, given that you can stand the smell. Besides the same view can be had from camel's back road and for free!!!

title: Dont Miss this !!
review: ITs really worth it . Ropeway plus awesome view. It's got that good feel about it with mountains around to view. Get dressed in gharwal dresses and getting clicked with picturesque background is something one should do atleast once here.

title: Good for one time
review: Kids loved travelling in the ropeway. They enjoyed shooting and bow and arrow, and hoopla games at Gun Hill. If you visit in the morning hours you will find clouds around you esp when you are visiting the place in the month of August. There is nothing much to do other than than admiring the scenic beauty and getting pics clicked.

title: Gun Hill
review: Nice Place to visit however with the Ropeway closed for maintainence in feb,the place becomes less attractive.

title: Mountain Top Views
review: The Rope way is under Maintenance - it is quiet a walk to the Top to see Gun Hill - nothing Spectacular about this place - Just Routine Fast Food - Loads of Fancy Clothes to let u enjoy Photos dressed like a Garhwal Resident of the Villages !!

title: Awesome Views of Himalayas
review: Go to the Gunhill Top in the morning hours like at around 10.30 or 11 when the shops will not be open there. This way you can peacefully enjoy the views of the Himalayas on a clear day without the hassles of the crowd. Gangotri, Yamnotri both are visible from here.

title: Nice Fun
review: Its one of the best point of Mussoorie.. Was wonderful & fun going by the Ropeway! Has awesome views of the valleys & mountains nearby

title: Killed by commercial activity
review: Gorgeous views - but you will struggle to see any as at the site has numerous kiosks blocking all view!! The place is full of very cheap and worn out shops, that have local games like balloon shooting and hoops etc that cater to kids.. Don't go if u expect peace and tranquil. There are two ways to get to  Gun Point - an uphill walk of 15 to 20 mins, or the rope way ride. We walked up and that was the best part of the visit. But need to caution that the walkway does not have consistent side railing/ barriers towards the cliff side, and there are patches of loose gravel. Overall, there isn't much to do in this town, so u can visit this place for what it's worth.

title: Time pass & photography
review: Just for time pass..u give 25/-rs for rope-way then they will leave u  in gun hill(pick of a hill)..in gun hill u will found nothing but shooting games or lottery like..although in mussorie I found everywhere this kind of games..

title: Trek to Gun Hill
review: If you have done the rope way, try trekking to Gun Hill first thing in the morning to watch the sunrise.  the trek is a bit steep and is for people who are comfortable with it.

title: NIce ropeway ride
review: Gunhill point is nice place to be for 1-2hrs....too much commercialized on the top point.you can spend a couple of hours there with family playing games .

title: Only for the view
review: There is a nice ropeway ride which takes you to Gun Hiill from Mussoorie town. The ride is short but enjoyable with nice views.

title: Dont miss it if you are first time visitor to Mussoorie
review: This is one of the star attractions of Mussoorie. You can go via road or rope-way. I recommend rope-way. You will get some wonderful views from the gun hilltop. There are lots of shops like food stalls, shooting games, magic tricks, photographers who are desperate to get you clicked in the traditional dress. Enjoy it.

title: Great View
review: This place can be reached by a ropeway cable car. Its worth visiting this sight seeing point as you get lovely view of the snow capped mountains from here. The binoculars available at this point are worth every penny that you spend on them. You have a lot of game options for the children also here.

title: no need to go there
review: there is no need to go to these place. i personally found it terrible and if ur short of time then dont visit it

title: The cable car... nothing much more
review: The cable car took us to the top of gun-hill.... It's a steep cable ride and if you're comfortable with heights, you might enjoy it... However, not much to talk about at the top, just a bunch of stalls with balloon shooting games, photography etc... All in all a very average 1 hour spent.

title: The Great View
