review: The view from that point of supb.  The photographs from that point are the perfect picture of hills and surroundings

title: good place
review: A view down from the famous Gun hill. Cable cars can be seen

title: Must visit if you stay in Mussorie
review: Though just a hilltop with a few shops, it makes it up for the views of the valley on various sides.

title: Excellent
review: Its always fun going up there by trolley,Being at a higher altitude it gives you a beutifull scenic view of the mountains.

title: rope way to gun hill
review: its a good place to spend time with a good view, rope way is good though the they stack almost 12 people in a single car. The Gun is silent and i as not able to find it. They should have maintained it as souvenir from the past

title: Awesome view
review: well I like to visit here because I wanted to take 'Rope-way (trolley)'. The view is very good, the best part was it rained in the morning and the sky everything was covered with clouds, I enjoyed the view and weather!

title: The shops spoil it all
review: Its amazing how the authorities have allowed the place to be completely surrounded by shops which have barely left any space to enjoy the view. Apparently a handlful of people own most of these shops which peddle typical touristy stuff and bad food. I think the government should only allow limted no. of shops so that the tourists can enjoy what this place is all about.

title: Just okay ... nothing much to do !
review: After much waiting, you will get to board the cable car which will carry you to the top the hill, where you will have hardly anything to do !

title: Old World Charm
review: Nothing much to offer except for the name-sake although a good time spent with my family. The cable ride also is a craze.

title: a must
review: Gun hill is a place to chill,shop,play games,have a cable car ride and see many spectacular views of the Himalayas.The walk up to the point is joyful,you could also go there in a cable car.The cable car is good,but you have to wait to get on it.I have visited Mussoorie many times and i have mostly gone to the hill by walking.One time,i was able to see the majestic peak of the K2.The place has many gaming options for kids like the balloon bursting,watching mountain peaks from telescopes and many other things.The place is amazing and it has a great height.It is a must visit.

title: Stunning views
review: The views were amazing but the stalls and restaurants surrounding area was run down, shabby and unkempt. A disappointment.

title: Stupendous position
review: Although the position is fantastic, the place is a little run down and tired.Worth a visit for the view.We walked up from Avalon Mussorie but there is a lift from the town

title: Good view
review: No other nearby place to visit

title: A bit tacky, but nice views
review: You can walk up from the Mall, but it is steep climb, best go on the Ropeway. Once there, there is not much to do, unless you like souvenirs, cows, photographers who will photograph you in costume and fast food shops. There are though some great views over Mussoorie and Landour.

title: rainy gun hill
review: couldnt get any view when we reached the top,but the cable car was good. good maggi and kachaloo chaat made up for it.

title: Wts there to c up there?
review: Take the alternate route of going on foot, rather than the cable cars, you might end up tired but will remember the experience for sure

title: Needs more to it...
review: Other than the cable car ride, there is nothing novel to this tourist spot. It has the same kinds of nick-knacky wares being sold that one would find on Mall road... the view from a few spots is spectacular, but the stalls tend to cover most of that, unless you step around to the periphery... it's NOT a trip I'd make again when in Mussoorie.

title: Nothing much except shops.
review: There is no gun on gun hill. Only shops and shops of all kinds food, photographers, souvenirs. The only good part was telescope  if you are lucky you may see snow covered mountains.

title: Like a UK beach resort!
review: Hoopla, magic tricks, costume photo offers, rifle ranges, it's all here to Disneyfy the view (er, and no view the day I went, as it was pure fog). But worth it for the kitsch factor.

title: Only worth going for the cable ride
review: Very little to do at the top. Some stalls and shops. Managed to find a beer :)

title: Not worth it
review: The cable car ride is good at Gun Hill there are just a few shops. We expected the place to have a walking trail or a nice view but other than a few shabby shops there was nothing.

title: It was a good time pass
review: Cable ride was good but the best part was walking down by foot in evening. You can see whole Mussoorie in lights.

title: Ropeway is good and nice weather up there
review: There is not much when you go up, just a few shops and eating stalls etc. but the view and the weather (nice winds blowing) is good

title: What there to see here?
review: Frankly the only thing on offer at Gun Hill point is a view of the hills and the valley. Unfortunately these get blocked by the numbers of stalls / shops that pepper this point. These shops are mundane shops that have nothing really to offer. Don't try the food at any of the shops. You will surely fall sick.

title: Dependable ValleyView Point
review: Its just a part of something you do whenever yuo go to Mussoorie. Take the Gondola ticket, wait for an hour, board the Gondola and reach upstairs to get an amazing view of the valley. Ofcourse what has not changed is people pestering you to wear Kashmiri dresses and get yourself photographed. There are a few small restaurants which serve ok food and drinks and you can get your basic colas, mineral water and candies here. Just soak in the place and try and jump on to a few spots to get a good look in.

title: Learn here - "How to make yourself fool "
review: We wasted atleast 3 hours to get our number for the rope-way & at last resulted as making ourselves fool.

title: Winter time is best.
review: In winters you get to see the Himalayas very clearly, and there is a really nice view from up there. You can see almost everything in Mussoorie, the Himalayas and a very nice view of Dehradun as well.

title: View is panaromic from Gun hill
review: You can reach gunhill either by walking uphill OR by ropeway (Rs. 75 per person to and fro). Location is mid way on mall road. Once you reach at gunhill you can use your return ticket anytime for coming back on mall road till the ropeway service ends....View from there is very panaromic and complete because its located at higher altitude than mall road. Ride of ropeway is less than 5 minutes. On gunhill there are many shops. Do try eating in restaurant which faces towards valley. We enjoyed Litchi juice with amazing views.

title: Go there by ropeway trolley
review: It is on the other end of mall road. Go there by ropeway trolley. There are some shops of your interest. Photographers will help you with some memorable trick photography. You can also buy a few souveniers there.

title: Old ropeway, not well maintained
review: Lost it's charm. Been visiting Gun Hill since the early 70's and the charm is all gone. Only shops selling trinklets, soveneirs etc are there to see. However, the view of Doon vally is still enthralling.

title: Good Place to See
review: Gone to Gun hill with Rope-way. Over all place is ok as it's on height and you get very good view of high peak mountains. This place is having a lot of shops especially photographers offering photo with local dress and small rides for kids.

title: At least a part of Mussoorie Trip
review: As almost all viewer's mentioned two ways to land to this place -> trek or trolley. Trolley is not that fun, but convenient for those in family (esp ladies and kids). Its a space for few shopkeepers to earn bread (Okay it was too rude to write..) But yes you will find few shops of souvenirs, and multiple items like toys, air guns , some food joints and few shops for trying your hands at shooting the balloons with air pistols. Apart from it you can enjoy the distant view to far away mountains and

title: First View of the Himalayas...
review: The Ropeway, just opposite our Hotel, Mall Palace takes u to Gunhil but we preferred a walk instead. Yes we trekked up to Gun Hill. Since we visited there in April, there was less crowd. We had our first view of the Himalayas. We played games there, won also... :) Clicked photos in the typical Garhwal Dress... many restaurants also caters good food.. and yes, visited the shanidev and parvati mata temple, which is just adjacent.

title: Worthless..
review: Not much to see, one needs to stand in a queue for ropeway for atleast 2 hours and then once you reach gun hill you think 2 hours were too much to spend on this..

title: About Gun Hill
review: Gun Hill is at the end of the Mussoorie Mall Road. Either you walk up to the Gun Hill or take a trolley car to reach the place, which would take you just 3 minutes, The place is nothing great. It is situated on the water reservoir tank where the entire Mussoorie gets their water supply from. What else! You have some gaming zones like shooting, aiming on the cans, ring game, darts, etc..There are some shops which would sell wooden handicrafts, clothes, purses, etc and you can purchase your stuffs from them after a good bargain.

title: Not much to it
review: It was a cloudy day, as in, the ride up was in the clouds and from the top you didn't get a view of anything but the clouds.  It did have it's own eerie sorta beauty.  Up top it's like an Indian carnival, games, cheap tourist items, couple food stands and a temple.

title: Full of shops. No view from here.
review: The Gun Hill has too many people waiting at the rope-way to go there and when you reach there, you only witness too  many shops. Nothing else!

title: average place
review: just attrection only rope way...other wise no thing i seeing threre

title: give it a miss
review: After waiting for 2 hours in the cable car queue this was the most dissappointing location. There are only shops and shops and nothing more. May be on a different day one could see the cliffs  i guess. But certainly not worth the wait.

title: Its awesome!!
review: after reaching the gunhill one can see heart threatning views of himalayas!!!

title: nothing much
review: the best was the trip on the cycle ricksaw and nothing more. dont think it was worth watching these points. Points had nothing for sight seeing but a nice journey on cycle ricksaw felt pitty for the man carrying us.

title: Good Sights
review: Nice place to spend a couple of hours with sights of Mussorrie and Dehradoon.

title: Average Experience on Gun Hill
review: Gunhill is the second highest point in Mussoorie. There are two ways to get there, 1) Trek 2) Rope-way. Trek begins from court complex on mall road. On an average it takes 20 minutes to get there. This place has water supply tank for Mussoorie.

title: Cable Car and that's it!
review: Cable car would have given excitement if it would have been year 1912 and would have been of 1 km. Sadly Gun hill doesn't satisfy both. Its 2012 and kids never get excited to see 200m cable car looming over few hotels roof tops and ending at an open place where organised shop keepers encircle you with indigenous sports games or for photo shoots.

title: Nice Experience
review: I have been to Gun Hill 2 - 3 times as a kid and as an adult.... As a kid, I really liked the cable car ride 10 years ago... But, in my last visit, we did not go by cable car instead we walked till gun hill and it was a wonderful experience.... I went their with my friends... On our way, we enjoyed the serene beauty of this place...

title: Dressed to kill
review: Gun Hill by name you should know that its dangerous adventure land. I liked the point of visit to such an exotic place. WOW.
